Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointing all in all”
Reviews.Author: tallgirl1975
Reviews.Content: We booked in to the Hotel Barcelona Catedral after an enquiry for one of their wheelchair accessible rooms/bathrooms. The room was clean and quite spacious with a large comfortable bed. Sadly there was no flip down seat and shower in the bathroom, which would have been easier rather than a bath without hand rails. Though the location was ideal and could not be faulted, we felt the breakfast was really bad, especially for the price. Its a good hotel in a good part of town and just 5 mins walk from the Airport Bus stop, but for the price we paid we thought it was just far too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel With A Central Location”
Reviews.Author: B.G._Chicago
Reviews.Content: We were quite impressed with our stay at the Hotel Barcelona Catedral. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, and the hotel is quite posh looking. Our room contained two beds, and it was decorated in a modern and fun fashion. For example, we had lollypops waiting for us on our pillows instead of the usual chocolates at night. Additionally, the room contained a safe, toiletries, and a hair dryer. The free wi fi in the room was also greatly appreciated. Location-wise, the hotel was very close to Las Ramblas and the Cathedral. Thankfully, the hotel was on a side street, which we found to be quite quiet and peaceful compared to these areas. The hop on/hop off busses were nearby - we thought this bus was a necessity given the huge size of Barcelona and the distance between the main attractions and sights. We went back and forth regarding whether we should stay in another area (the Eixample, etc.) or stay closer to Las Ramblas. I am happy with the choice that we made. The only negative is that the hotel was incredibly expensive compared to our other stays in Spain. Of course, we picked the one weekend when Barcelona was playing Madrid for football, so perhaps that led to the high room prices. I can't say that we received a room that was comparable to the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: steve c
Reviews.Content: You couldn't find a better location, central to everything going on, with just enough privacy to escape the masses. A peaceful roof terrace, crisp and modern facilities, and most helpful staff ranks this hotel as one of the best. We didn't see any other hotel that comes even close on our travels around Barcelona. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Barcelona Catedral”
Reviews.Author: olivier_air
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, and if you want to go to the beaches or Mont Juic, they lend bikes...

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: JoopRI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an excellent location on a quiet side street of the plaza in front of the cathedral. A short walk to buses, main shopping areas, numerous restaurants. Fairly close to the Picasso museum and the Bocqueria on the Ramblas. Very friendly and helpful staff. Excellent breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: SJB383973
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a perfect spot for sightseeing. The rooms were small but nicely appointed. The roof provided a nice spot for wine and cheese from the markets. Outdoor cafe close by and everything including metro was close by.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: LAWoodLondon
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect - right in the middle of the old town. It is walking distance to the square where you get dropped off by the airport bus (5mins), the harbour and beaches, the rambles, as well as all the back streets with restaurants and quirky boutiques. Staff are very helpful and friendly, facilities are modern and clean, and it is quiet (not on a main road or has roudy pubs nearby). Highly reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Such a very pleasant stay ...”
Reviews.Author: Rossella45
Reviews.Content: Very nice and quiet location, 5 minutes walk far from the Ramblas and Placa Calatalunya. Modern hotel, clean and very good staff expecially at receiption. We do appreciate breakfast in the morning with fresh pastry and hot plates. It was my first time in Barcelona, the second for my husband and we would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redrumUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay at the end of March . Location is perfect , hotel modern with all expected amenities . Very clean and staff excellent and helpful especially on reception . Restaurant not open in the evening ( bar meals can be ordered or room service ) but we had a nice lunch there one day althought not cheap but there again Barcelona in general is not cheap . Can highly recommend the free Wednesday night "Legends " guided tour . Unlike a recent reviewer we did not experience or see any problems with pickpockets / muggers .

Reviews.Title: “The good then the bad...”
Reviews.Author: steve049
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location, but be very aware!! the wrong turn behind the hotel and you will get pickpocketed or mugged.. The hotel was very comfy and staff friendly, however take plenty of money as the hotel is not inexpensive but very expensive!! Do not eat or drink from the mini bar, so expensive. The beach part of Barcelona was brilliant and very clean and friendly..Alas though, there was not any tiolets to be seen and all out of order, then they charged us 5 euros to go to the tiolet..Which was miles away from our part of the beach. That was the good but the bad is that the whole place is very scary.. Muggers everywhere, we had money stolen twice from pickpockets that looked ethnic minotiry but could not tell whom they where as the whole place is mixed with varies races. Do not accept any cards or leaflets or anything from any starnger as they will pounce on you and steal and rob you and you will not even notice, they are that good.. We did not have one good meal, the waiters where rude... unhelpful... and every meal was cold and looked as if they had the smallest portions ever seen.. Most places do tapas and we love that type of food but the portions where terrible and always cold, to be then ridiculed by the staff at most restraunts..We sat down in the sun had a sangria and a pint and was charged £18 pounds to my dismay that most places where this expensive.. There was not a lot of english and lots of americans who where getting mugged and robbed at every corner.. I have been to Barcelona the past 6 years on the trot.. This was my last.. BEWARE EVERYONE...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: merlej23
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location is perfect - three different subway stops are an easy walk. The hotel is spotless, and very quiet considering it is steps away from the Cathedral. Everything was comfortable. The best part was the staff - they are friendly, helpful and considerate. They recommended some great places to eat. There is free wifi, but it is weak and I was unable to access some of my apps. Fortunately there are three computers downstairs for one's use. I would certainly want to stay again, and feel it was well-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great central location”
Reviews.Author: Peter&Ann
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in March 2012, paying €130 per night for bed & breakfast. The hotel is down a short side-street off the large square fronting the old cathedral. It’s a great central location, easy walking distance to everything in the city centre. Hotel staff are pleasant and helpful, all we encountered spoke good English. There are three pcs with free internet access available to residents. Our room was a reasonable size, comfortable and well equipped. Bathroom was clean and modern. TV had a number of English-speaking channels, of the news variety. Tea/coffee making facilities in the room are charged @ €1.50, with only two “mini-cartons” of milk provided each day. My only gripe. Breakfast comprised a good continental buffet with hot options available from the kitchen. I wouldn’t recommend the scrambled egg, but everything else we had was good. We didn’t have any other meals in the hotel. The nearest metro, I think, is Jaume on Via Laetiana, about a half-mile walk. We had dinner at Café de l’Academia, Montiel and 4 Gats – all were worth a recommendation, probably in the order I’ve listed them from a food perspective, though 4 Gats would win on “atmosphere”. This was our first stay at this particular hotel, after several trips to Barcelona over the past decade. I’d consider it good value at that price and we’d be happy to return there. Incidentally, there’s a good, almost invisible Japanese restaurant called Shunka located almost directly behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: indoorsy
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with this hotel, rooms were a good size, comfortable bed and bathroom was spotless with a decent shower. Location was ideal, so central! And the hotel was nice and quiet. Found the staff to be very helpful, the only complaint Id have was the wifi was patchy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Barcelona Catedral and its staff were an asset to our hen do!”
Reviews.Author: anon19
Reviews.Content: Just a week back from our weekend stay in this great hotel. 6 girls in 2 rooms for my sister's hen do.. We checked in quickly, the staff were very helpful and fantastic at recommending places to go to eat, to dance and to drink. 'Jordi' and colleagues on the front desk were happy to show us how to get round the city, ordered taxi's and gave us good directions. The hotel's location is fantastic. The rooms were large enough for 3 of us with lots of toiletries. Only problems I encountered were the on/ off wifi and the air con was not the best, but windows could be opened. Great chill out area, nice bar and lobby to get food and drinks. On our last day we were even allowed to keep one of our rooms as we had a late flight. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, dependable, without being exceptional”
Reviews.Author: TheHoodedBanoonigan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barcelona Catedral is the girl your mum always wanted you to marry but you never noticed; good, dependable, without being exceptional. So, what’s she like then? The Executive Rooms are clean and modern, a decent size and boast a generous bathroom. The wifi is less generous, and only partially mitigated by the availability of three public terminals downstairs (almost always occupied). The service is standard, but, as we discovered after 4 days here, far more friendly than you will receive elsewhere in this tourist-fatigued city. We passed on the expensive breakfast, but my wife enjoyed the upstairs pool area in her downtime whilst I watched the multitude of channels dedicated to Lionel Messi. Barca is a big city whose attractions are spread far and wide, so a judgment on location is particularly subjective. For those looking to be close to the old Gothic Quarter, and close to La Ramblas without being fully immersed in its chaos day and night, this is the perfect choice. Tucked away in a side street near the old Cathedral, you are close enough to the action that you can walk to your destination, but also get a good night’s sleep. Take note though, the walk to La Sagrada Familia is an epic, and the restaurants closest to the Hotel offered mostly over-priced tourist fodder, uninspired at best. All told: good, dependable, without being exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Catedral”
Reviews.Author: RomaLauretta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the center of the Barrio Gotico perfect to reach every point of interest but as the same time quiet and esay to reach

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, and helpful. The location is great. Quiet, but close to all the city-centre areas. Food seemed a bit over-priced, but with so many restaurants and cafes/tapas bars near by, this wan't a problem

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Darshan1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is around the corner from the Cathedral, so I doubt they have many (or any) rooms with great views, and it might feel unsafe for a woman to walk along that short alley to the front door late at night, but other than that, I thought this was a great find. It is a bit difficult for taxis to get you right to this hotel's front door, so be prepared to roll your suitcase a short block from Via Laetana. The room was comfortable, quiet, and a bit dark - good for sleeping if not really reading. The breakfast was delicious. The front desk staff were very helpful when explaining how to use the free internet or how to get to various attractions. The restaurants around the corner (in front of the cathedral) seemed to be rip offs, but Bar Babia directly across from the hotel seemed more for locals and was delicious. There's also a sandwich shop at the other end of the cathedral's plaza from the hotel that is affordable and good if you want to buy sodas for your room. It's easy walking distance to the Rambla, to Plaza Catalunya (and the subway), and to the churches Santa Maria del Mar and Santa Maria del Pi.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but be careful”
Reviews.Author: rushfjo
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, quiet, very modern and very friendly staff - well situated for those on foot in middle of pedestrian area right next to Cathedral and a maze of streets full of shops and restaurants - 2 negative notes - one of our party had their pocket picked just outside - it didn't feel an unsafe area - but we gather it wasn't uncommon. The other was a surprise that the bar shut at 11 pm - I thought Spain kept going all through the night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Barcelona Catedral”
Reviews.Author: Laila65
Reviews.Content: Very, very good location,- although a bit difficult to find the way by car in spite of navigator due to frequent alteration of closing the streets for traffic... Not so nice when you happen to arrive in the middle of the night. Apart from that - the location couldn´t hardly be better. You are right in the middle of everything! Friendly and helpful staff, nice room. Free wireless internet, free fitness centre, good breakfast. Quiet and pieceful. We were there in February - was a bit cold on the floor in the room. In the restaurant where breakfast was served it was cold too - I chose to wear a jacket. But - everything else made this a very good hotel - I would not hesitate to stay there next time I visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service. We'll came back”
Reviews.Author: Nino B
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in Barcelona, and felt like being at home. The service was brillant and ready to meet our needs; in particular, we feld it nice the way the manager kindly advised we were supposed to check out in the morning when it was already dark. The location is simply perfect and everything is very close. Besides, it takes just a few minutes from the hotel to get to two subway stations and a taxi station. The room was modern and confortable. We would suggest it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: BGPLondon
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights here at the end of a whistlestop tour of Catalunya, following our son's youth orchestra. Loved everything about the place. Terrific location, great staff. Cool, not overstyled rooms. The rooftop pool was a really special extra. Lovely food too - the lunch menu was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: DJSCMac
Reviews.Content: Hotel was really nice, seemed like a great place for business, although we went for vacation. It's right next to the Barcelona Cathedral, so within walking distance to alot of shops, restaurants and even the city beach. It's just a few blocks from the metro, which was really easy to use, to get to some of the other sites in the city (Sagrada Familia, etc.). Also, our room was a really nice size and big bathroom which was a change to other hotels in europe. We never ate breakfast or dinner at the hotel, so no comments on that, but otherwise, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Hotel is very close to Barcelona Cathedral. Just a 5 minute walk to Las Ramblas too. .The hotel staff were very co-operative. Rooms were ok. The bed and the pillows were very comfortable. The included breakfast was excellent. WiFi for free in the lobby. There was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Restaurant was closed for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - friendly helpful staff, good for friends or business associates”
Reviews.Author: Jane-Jersey-Cruiser
Reviews.Content: Four couples completed a cruise in September and were looking for a location in Barcelona in the historic area that was on a quieter street than Las Ramblas. We found it! Right around the corner from Barcelona Cathedral and on a lovely square filled with restaurants and people. The staff are very accommodating, and the rooms are quite large and comfortable. The hotel is quiet at night. We were there in September, it was HOT and the air conditioning stood up to the test. The complete breakfast was just what we were looking for to fuel up for a day sightseeing, traveling into the countryside to visit Cava vineyards, etc. And there's an option for the Continental (light) version of breakfast without having to wander the streets. Bar service is fun too. Several evenings, we received a recommendation from the front desk for excellent restaurants within walking distance and had memorable meals. The modern vibe and clean decor in the hotel is engaging. When we purchased many bottles of Cava to share with the group, the kitchen delivered champagne flutes and ice in just a few minutes - what a great way to finish up our memories of Barcelona. We would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: JEM782
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not plush but it meets all the criteria for a good stay.The hotel staff is courteous and helpful. The location is phenomenal, walking distance to many sites and plenty of delicious restaurants and tapas bars. The cathedral square is bustling with energy and you feel safe walking around the area well into the night. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mayapoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for few days while touring Barcelona prior to cruise. Comfortable rooms, very modern and updated. Front desk staff were very helpful. Cute rooftop pool and loungers. Great location, walking distance to many attractions. Only negative would be that air conditioning slightly anemic. Would recommend and return again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine a better location”
Reviews.Author: Peaches616
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best location in Barcelona for sights, sightseeing, walking, eating and hanging out. Staff was very accomodating,room clean and bright, bathroom ultra modern,internet free and convenient. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: mik16
Reviews.Content: A good central hotel with friendly staff, and a comfortable modern room. We arrived very early on a Sunday morning after a cruise and were offered a very early check in as well as a walking tour around the old city, will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for 1st timer”
Reviews.Author: ect_sg
Reviews.Content: Thank you Trip Advisor ! We had a lovely 3 day stay at Barcelona Catedral.located in a quiet area but very near the Catedral . Everything was easily accessible and we had little grocery shops nearby to buy milk as we had a kettle to make our morning wake up cuppa. The 2 famous markets were a few minutes walk, to do breakfast/Tapas, get local fruits and produce(assorted jamon) The smokefree room and bath was very modern and clean, nice beds. found the minifridge overstocked as we don't drink that much alcohol ! Very nice buffet breakfast from cereals, fruits to cooked bacon/sausage and eggs was included in our room rates. Reception personnel was very kind and helpful, they'll print out a map to show you how to get to your desired destination.You'll need them as.many little alleys abound in our Barri Gotic location. Tapas bars and lots of interesting shops(Caelum) to indulge, but there are atms(cash withdrawals for 6 digits cards) around to facilate your enjoyment. We had such a fabulous time that we are coming back next year a bit later, in Oct as it was a bit hot in mid Sept....

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the the Gothic Quarter”
Reviews.Author: poshnosh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Catedral for 2 nights and was pleasantly surprised when I was able to check-in at 7am after my 12 hour flight. A very nice touch! Rooms were clean but the bed can be a bit stiff and the water plug for the show ever kept getting clogged (not funny bathing when your feet are constantly soaked). English TV channels were limited to BBC World. HouseKeeping left very little to be desired. They never replenished my water bottles and the room never looked like it was cleaned. Instead the bed was just made daily. Lastly, we were impressed that the hotel offered complimentary guided tours of the Gothic Quarter on Sundays at 10am. This 1 hour tour with a certified guide from the Tourism Office offered a personalized insightful touch to the area that surrounds the hotel. Barcelona is a beautiful city and the location of the Catedral is ideal. In the heart of the Gothic Quarter and 2 streets away from Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nik0l
Reviews.Content: Came for a business trip. Booked a single room. Very spacious and clean. Good staff and nice facilities. It is a bit away from the metro station though. But, in walking distance to la rablas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant vibe, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: parisgirlnj
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights at Barcelona Catedral. Superior double on the first floor (which is really the 2nd floor). 950 E. On the corner, view of an interesting, natty little piazza with a Vietnamese restaurant that's got outdoor tables, orange umbrellas, heat lamps. The windows very solid so only heard noise of revellers a bit on Friday and Saturday nights, but not enough to prevent sleep. The main sleeping area is boxy, floor-to-ceiling windows, and not huge, but not tiny for two people who like each other. Beds extremely firm. Bathroom large and comfortable--lovely pressure in the shower (but had no hot water one a.m. when we got up late!). Breakfast served in a serene, lovely space with lots of windows. Pros: Location. So nice to be in the barri gotic, but NOT on La Rambla, and in an out-of-the-way alley that is not out of the way at all. Easy walk with luggage to Catalunya, and steps from the old cathedral. Public areas--restaurant, lounge, lobby--did not see pool area--all comfortable and attractive (modern, lots of glass, light fabrics, greens and purples). Staff--helpful and pleasant, though we did not ask much of them. Room--felt like a small oasis; really enjoyed the view--lots of people come and go through that alley, but not all at once, and the scene at the Vietnamese place was interesting and festive (great food, by the way). Cons: they charge 10 euros per day for wireless, which is annoying (fortunately they have 3 computers in the lobby for guests, which were usually pretty easy to get on to--then again, I imagine it could get very busy during high season). The breakfast was OK but not amazing--included in our room price. If I had been paying 22 euros for it, I wouldn't have been too psyched. In all, I felt this was a great hotel in the neighborhood--I would definitely consider returning to this hotel, or finding another in a similar locale. My one suggestion to the management would be go ahead and offer free wireless--it will make your guests very happy.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: enidblyton_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my other half for 3 nights, as a Birthday treat... for me! Had a brilliant time! Situated near the Cathedral, as you may've guessed (!), which makes it easy to find in the Gothic area. Lovely spacious room, huge comfy bed, good sized bathroom..... & breakfasts more than ample to start your day. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service”
Reviews.Author: Swedman
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the middle of everything this is the place. Unfortunately couldnt we use the courtyard nor the roof top terrace because of the weather but it looked nice. The big benefit is nonetheless the staff and the excellent service they provide.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for a perfect city....”
Reviews.Author: wclegends
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Barcelona Catedral is our choice whenever we come to Barcelona. And we just spent another five nights there. It is a very professional hotel, with a wonderfully helpful front desk staff, and it is perfectly located. It is 1/2 block from the every active, very large catedral plaza, with two very good tapas restaurants, and walking distance to the Ramblas, the Gothic quarter, and the Bourn area. It is also very close to the Jaume 1 metro stop. What's not to like about it???

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great experience in the city. Perfect location and so close to La Ramblas! The staff was very friendly and helpful with answering questions. The rooms were very clean & comfortable. A great hotel overall. I would definitely stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gweight
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, quiet and comfortable. It is in a great location across the square from the main cathedral and close to everything. Definitely would stay here if I go back to Barcelona. Nice perk was the free use of bicycles (mtn bikes). Was ready to rent a bike and asked staff for a recommendation of where to rent - no need, bikes are provided free to guests. Roof top pool was great after a day of wandering the streets in the August heat. Never tried the restaurant as we generally stay away from hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: marianf66
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and well appointed, but when booking my room, they suggested I take the hotel breakfast which was very expensive. My son ended up with a stomach bug and they would not let me take the breakfast off my rate even though it was the following day.....Like paying a restaurant before you eat. SO I recommend the hotel but suggest you DO NOT GET THE BREAKFAST. Just order it in the morning if you want it. It's the same price. They made it seem like I was getting a bargain by booking it in advance, but all I really did was waste 36 Euros on nothing. I suggest you go across the street, spend 1/3 of the price.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Europe for our 6 year old”
Reviews.Author: J A
Reviews.Content: This was my daughter's first time in Europe and the first time any of us visited Barcelona. I selected this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. We LOVED It. The location can't be beat, it was clean, quiet, and even had a pool on the roof! The staff was friendly and helpful. I have travelled extensively around the world, and would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona who wants to be centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “recommended for location and service”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn H
Reviews.Content: It took no time to get oriented to the maze of alleyways that is the most fascinating characteristic of Barcelona because this hotel is so well located, on a quiet street.. Executive dble room proved to be very spacious,with an enormous bathroom, comfortable bedding and towels. Robes available for a price. Easy walking distance to Placa Catalyuna and La Rambla.Very helpful staff gave us good dining recommendations also within walking distance. Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Second time in 2 years!”
Reviews.Author: mram18
Reviews.Content: I have visited Barcelona for the second time since 2009 and i went straight back to hotel Catedral. It is in the best location, really clean and quiet. The members of staff have been more than helpful especially when we needed to rent a car. They found a good deal for us and the car was waiting for us at the door when we needed it. Then we just parked it by the hotel and the members of staff contacted the company to pick it up for us. The service was more than amazing and the room wonderful. We were not bothered by the cleaning staff at all when in the hotel but always find the room clean when back. I would recommend highly the place, as it is located at the best spot. Thank you again for a lovely time in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located & Superb caring staff”
Reviews.Author: JNGCAL
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance of the Picasso Museum, the Cathedral and Las Ramblas. Short ride by taxi to the Gaudi exhibits. The cafe's all around the Hotel afford you plenty of oppurtunity to people watch and enjoy great local fare and free entertainment. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who reads this. Gene & Janet C

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan G
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, centrally located but still a very pleasant and quiet place to stay. The staff could not have been more helpful (we were travelling with our small baby and everything we asked for was provided) and we really enjoyed the stay. I would certainly stay here again, and would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: emma4646
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 3 children (20months,4,and 12) stayed in rooms 212+213 for 4 nights.The hotel is centrally located in the Gothic quarter yet quiet.The interconnecting rooms have a small hallway between them which was ideal for "soundproofing" since we have a toddler who goes to bed early. The hotel is located near many restaurants/cafes,etc. which was a big bonus.Right downstairs from the hotel is a very good and authentic Vietnamese restaurant with ultra quick service.We often ate dinner there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: acon234
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Barcelona the best area to stay is the Gothic quarter and this hotel is right in the middle of it. The location is perfect. Everything is accessible when you stay here. The hotel is very nice, we stayed for a week and had no complaints at all about this hotel. Clean, nice rooms, staff was friendly and helpful. There is a free walking tour and the hotel also has a few bikes that they give out to their guests as well. The roof has an indoor gym and a small pool. Perhaps the only thing I could pick on here was the wifi in the rooms. There is an extra charge for it and it was very slow. But wasn't here for business so no big deal. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: blackmamba8
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in good location across from the Catedrale, near placa jaume and plaza mayor. Hotel has 3 computers with internet, but were typically occupied around the clock. Pool on the top floor, really just for lounging. Elevators were frequently broken and when operational very slow. Front desk service was nothing special. Quiet rooms with very modern amenities. The gym was adequate enough to get a decent work out in. Closest metro stations are placa jaume and placa espanya, with espanya being a major hub. If you're taking a taxi, have the driver take you to the Catedrale. The hotel is on a side street with limited access. The Catedrale is easier to get to and all the drivers know it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Ozzysix
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel on the outside enter and staff are not that interested just an ok hotel close to everything highlight was the free walking tour on the Wednesday nite excellent guide beware of the extras in this hotel will never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: AnnR_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on 28th September before going on a cruise. The room was a little small but very well appointed. The facilities were very good but the best part for us was the staff who went out of their way to help us with everything that we needed. The location was also superb and meant that we were able to do a lot of sight seeing in a very limited time. We didn't have time to make use of the pool area or restaurant but would like to stay again so that we could sample both.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service not super friendly”
Reviews.Author: Unadave
Reviews.Content: First off, don't arrive early, they kept a huge queue of people waiting to check in well up until 3-4pm. We had taken an overnight train in from Paris and arrived around 10am and had to wait sometime until we could actually get into our room to clean up, etc. The hotel was in a good area, just off of Romblas. The main cathedral was right next door, and the open square as well. We only stayed there for 1 night, so I cannot say too much about the service as we only experienced a brief interaction with the staff. We got the room through priceline and saved some $$. Breakfast service was very very slow, We ate there 2 mornings, it seemed very understaffed.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Californiatennis
Reviews.Content: My husband, 28-yr. old son, and I stayed in the Executive Triple for 3 nights Oct. 16-18. The room wasn't huge but it was fine for us, and was very modern, with a very good sized bathroom, also very modern.. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. The location is fantastic: As others have said, the hotel is on a quiet street, just across a plaza from the Cathedral. The Barri Gotic (gothic quarter) is about a 30-second walk away. Good shopping (El Corte Ingles, H&M, Zara, and others) are about a 2 min. walk away, as are some great restaurants. (We ate dinner one night at El Quatre Gats, a legendary place, and it did not disappoint. Would highly recommend a splurge there.) From the hotel, you can walk to all the major sites, except for Parc Guell and Montjuic, both of which should be on every visitor's list. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, so can't speak to that, and we were a little disappointed that there was a charge each day for wi-fi in the room. There are 3 computers in the lobby and they were getting a lot of use. All in all, this hotel has so many wonderful attributes and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly terrific”
Reviews.Author: JohnDCharleston_SC
Reviews.Content: Great location a stone's throw from the main cathedral, but off the noisy square. Large, clean rooms and very helpful staff. Lots of excellent restaurants within 5 minutes walk. But...breakfast is rather overpriced at 18 euros; so is internet access at 10 euros a day for truly lousy reception. Parking garage is not accessible to the hotel, so you have to walk up the ramp and outside--however, you do not want to drive in this part of Barcelona at all, and it's hard to get to the hotel by car. No printers for their public computers, so you have to email your boarding pass (or anything else) to the hotel for them to print. Truly bizarre!! Room cleaning was a bit hit or miss, with soap, toilet paper, and various towels often not supplied each day.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: misskiki15
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room here at the last minute and am very glad we did. Staff were very friendly and accommodating, moving us to another room when we mentioned our air con wasn’t working properly. Breakfast was expensive (€18 each I think) but really nice with a big spread of continental breakfast and hot food cooked fresh when requested. There are also a lot of cafés around that offer breakfast much cheaper though. Hotel was in a great central location in the gothic quarter. Room was a good size, modern, clean and the bed was fairly comfy. Would stay here again for the location alone!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: Zemie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great area and my wife and I were able to walk to everything we wanted to see. The hotel is located a little off of the main Cathedral square so it was pretty quiet. The hotel offers food services but we did not eat there just based on the 18.50 euros cost per person for the breakfast (close to $30 / person). There are a ton of restaurants and bakeries around the Cathedral square that offered much better prices and the food was terrific. I haven't done a review before, but I felt that people should be aware of how hard the beds were. Maybe it is an American thing that we like softer mattresses, but it felt like we were sleeping on boards. So in review, even though the staff was friendly and the hotel was modern and clean, we would recommend staying in a different hotel in the same area to try to find beds that you can actually get a good night's sleep (the whole point of a hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect visit”
Reviews.Author: Ayz54
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovely overnight at the Hotel, prior to a cruise. We arrived early in the morning, and our room was ready. The staff was helpful, polite and eager to assist. The room was spotless, modern, and came complete with an amenities pack..for the weary traveler! The rooftop pool was patio was nice, but we were only up there a a short while. The location was great and not noisy at all. We did not use the wi-fi, but there are computers for guest's use in the lobby. We did not use any of the food services, so just can't say.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: TrunteDK
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great service. Breakfast the best quality we have experienced for a long time. We used the free bikes as well as the swimmingpool with a great joy

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: YoPhilly
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean, hotel right around the corner from the old cathedral and about a 5-minute walk to Las Ramblas. Room was spacious, big bathroom, very comfortable bed. Our rate did not include breakfast and I knew they charge 18 euro per person, so we didn't intend to eat there, just stop for an early coffee. However, the tables looked so inviting so we stayed. Good choice - great selection of breads, jams, cereals, yogurt, juice, etc., etc., plus an entree selection from the menu. I had a selection of sausages and cheeses, and my husband had an omelet. 18 euro was a little pricey but we were certainly not disappointed in the food. The hotel was impeccably clean. We arrived very early in the morning - about 9 AM - so the front desk clerk stored our luggage while we explored for a few hours. All in all, this was a great choice for our purposes. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION,LOCATION,LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: piyush69
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect,just around corner from cathedral and very close to ramblas and plaza catalunya,and the metro stop is 500metres,also the stop for all sightseeing buses is 500metres.We were during the Le Merce festival and cathedral was one of the main hub of activities,every night, concerts were on,,just around the corner of the hotel,so was very convenient.Room size is good,rooms are neat and nicely done up.bathroom is large and clean.I have yet to stay in a hotel other than this which charges for tea and coffee in room,and also provides complimentary water in the room,just once whether you stay for 1 day or 5 days,its very mean of them.Staff is good.We did not have breakfast at the hotel as 18 euros ,its not worth,as there are better and cheaper options nearby.There are few computers in the lobby where you can check mails for free.The pool is much smaller than it appears in the photos.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Judi E
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Barcelona Catedral and it was wonderful. Our taxi from the train station brought us in the back way so when we exited the front door and walked 50 feet and turned the corner we about fell over! The Cathedral was right there! It was beautiful. The room was large and clean, the bed pretty comfortable but I've had better pillows! The bathroom was nice with a powerful shower and counter space. We brought our own coffee so we used the kettle in room - I think the 1.50 euro charge for coffee was silly! When you pay that kind of money for a room they should throw in 2 cups of coffee! The location was my favorite thing about staying here. It was right in the heart of the Gothic quarter- an easy and fun walk to the Ramblas, the Eixample, and wonderful restaurants. The red hop on-hop off bus stops right in front of the Cathedral so we rode that around the city and hopped off at all the Gaudi spots. If it wasn't for the pillows I would give this a hotel a "PERFECT!" but we would stay there again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: 2travelingbugs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location - close to the sights and metro. The rooms are a good size, quiet, and modern. Although Barcelona is very expensive, and the Catedral hotel is good value, still shop around and look for deals on different booking sites, like booking.com. Skip the hotel breakfast, and check out the nearby cafes for breakfast which are cheaper and more of an experience. If you stay here or in the area, check out the dining options on Argentiria, which is a 5 min walk. The front desk suggested this area to us and we went back every night. 2 things to watch out in this hotel - the picture of the rooftop pool is pretty misleading as I think the photo is taken from a very advantageous angle. 2nd, the beds are a little hard.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Daddyo1947
Reviews.Content: Hotel was modern and clean. Front desk spoke English but was hard to understand due to accent. Location was great located in the middle of Gothic Center and only a short walk to La Rambla. We arrived about 10AM and were able to get into or room. Breakfast was not included but you could purchase it for 18 Euros each. There was a taxi stand a short walk away. There was a nice pool on top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: suegeordie
Reviews.Content: Three night stay, couldn't beat the location. It was within easy walking distance to everything. Staff very helpful. Free walking tour on Sunday was a highlight as the tour guide was exceptional. Breakfast was included and you could have either buffet or a la carte. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “read reviews. stayed there. want to go there next year.”
Reviews.Author: kju77
Reviews.Content: went on a cruise. researched hotels. travel agents sent a list. we found this on the internet. the building is modern. the bathroom is modern and clean. the staff is friendly. the location is what i would appreciate most although each quality is equal to the other. it is not easy choosing an unknown hotel with an unknown address. i liked the information and insisted on getting this hotel. the location is fantastic. i will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “super holidays”
Reviews.Author: Andrea L
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 17 year old son and had together one room. Everthing was clean und the bathroom was really great. The place from the hotel is very central und we enjoyed our days there. There was a big party over three nights at the place near by, but the windows are so closed that we could sleep very well!! The pool on the top of the hotel was really a bonus and we enjoyed the stay! We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “great base”
Reviews.Author: dean b
Reviews.Content: We was very pleased with the location of this hotel, right in the centre of barca, but still surprisingly quiet, just off the sq of the cathedral, the rooms are of typical city hotel size, well appointed and clean. We found the staff also to be helpful and friendly. The pool on the 5th floor is a bonus and just whats needed after a days sight seeing, small but nice up there above the rooftops. Our breakfast was in with the deal and was adequate. I would reccomend this hotel to anybody with no regrets and thats probably the best anyone can say. One thing though please be aware of local pickpockets we was followed right into the hotel by a couple with backpacks posing as tourists and my mate felt her hand in his pocket after his wallet !!!! we was in a 4some and my mate and me are very well built scaffolder and builder, and this was still no detterent, so be careful, there is another scam on the beach where a nice unassuming girl has a folder and she will ask u to sign a petition (the folder has a disabled sticker on it) as she leans across your table she will take your phone wallet etc whatever is there!!!! when we told the police they said its a very common crime there by the beach so beware

Reviews.Title: “Very good, central, large bed”
Reviews.Author: UckfieldSue
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant 2 night stay. Room was small but delightful, with a huge double bed. I have never stayed at a hotel where you have to pay for the coffee / tea amenity pack. Breakfast not worth the steep 18 Euro charge per person. We thoroughly enjoyed delicious pastries from the wonderful Boqueria food market, just a short walk away on la Rambla. Expensive, but probably a fair price for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good - BUT”
Reviews.Author: sidneyxx
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel on reviews from Trip Advisor, and now coming home I have read the latest reviews. I would agree with virtually everything people have said. It is a good hotel in an excellent location, and overall the staff are equally excellent. But to nit-pick a bit I would mention the following three things (and I do this because it was not a cheap hotel to stay at). 1. We were thrilled to see they had tea/coffee making facilities. BUT you had to pay for your tea bags - as we only wanted tea and it was packaged with coffee, we had to pay 1.5 Euros to get two tea bags. We felt this was meanness. 2. You had to pay for internet access in your room - ever so many places these days offer free access. THEN to compound things, you couldn't just buy an hour or two access, you had to pay for 24 hours. We felt this too was meanness. There were 3 free computers in the lobby, but on two occasions two of them were not working - and not only we found this. 3. You can't get your room until 2 p.m. Fair enough - this is the policy of most hotels these days. However, we turned up at 1.50 p.m. and thought maybe our room would be ready. BUT no. We had to wait till 2 p.m. They offered to look after our luggage and told us to go and have a coffee/drink in their bar. We noticed quite a few people doing this. Anyway at 2.02 p.m. we noticed nobody had approached the counter, so my husband did. He said, could we now have the key. "Certainly", they replied and handed it over. This then caused a mini-rush from all the other waiting people. The room would certainly have been ready at 1.50 p.m. and again I think it was meanness of their part to make us wait 10 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peggy593
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night prior to our cruise, and wish we could have booked it on the way back. The room was comfortable and a nice size, great bathroom. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. Arrived early after our flight, the staff checked our bags and pointed us towards a nice public bathroom downstairs where we were able to brush our teeth and clean up a bit before heading out to sightsee. Comfortable large lobby. Absolutely wonderful location in the heart of Bari Gotic. Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: img712
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barcelona Catedral deserves all the praise that it receives here on Trip Advisor. it is only steps away from the cathedral in the Gothic quarter in Barcelona. Everything is within easy walking distance. The experience was perfect from being greeted by the bellhop to the front desk check in. Everyone that works at this hotel is friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms are a good size especially being in this price range. Their well appointed modern and comfortable. I will definitely come back to this hotel especially because of its location in the Gothic quarter my favorite part of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Petra S
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel with a fantastic location in the old area "Gothic quarter", walking distance to everything we wanted (nice cafees, restaurants, architecture, beach etc.) and the pool on the terrace was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: amelia9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barcelona Cathedral Hotel for 3 nights in early sept. We had a standard double room which was very comfortable. The room was spacious with plenty of storage space, a king size bed, flat screen TV, mini bar and safe. Our room faced an inner courtyard area and we had no noise problems. The bathroom was spacious with a shower over the bath tub and stocked with the usual amenities. The room was well cleaned every day and toiletries, towels etc replaced. This is not a luxury hotel but is very clean and comfortable. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as E18 per person is much too expensive. There are many cafes and bakeries close by for breakfast which offer a good variety. The hotel charges for tea and coffee packs in the room. At E1.50 per pack it wont break the bank if you really need a cup of tea or coffee, however I do feel the hotel should provide this free as the room rate is by no means cheap, (we paid E169 per night, which I consider to be expensive). The location of the hotel is excellent, opposite the Cathedral right in the middle of the Barri Gotic. It is very easy to walk to most areas and there are plenty of restaurants and shops in the vicinity. I have stayed in 4 hotels in Barcelona and so far this would be my favourite, based on location, cleanliness and comfort, although overall rather expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Hotel Barcelona Catedral”
Reviews.Author: fabulous_lottie
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 4 night stay in Barcelona. After consulting with TripAdvisor early 2011, we decided to book our accomodation at the HBC. We stayed on the second floor and had a very spacious room; in particular the bathroom. The bed was comfortable and there was good storage space to put away clothes etc. The rooftop swimming pool and sun lounge area was very nice, although the pool was "refreshing" (in otherwords - freezing!). We were very impressed with the location of the hotel. It was located on a little side street opposite the cathedral and was a 5 minute walk to Las Ramblas (main street of Barcelona). The hotel was also near to Catalunya, Liceu and Jaume metro stations. Barcelona's metro system is very good and an effective way to get around the city. Top attractions in Barcelona include the Picasso Museum, Font Magica, Camp Nau and the beach. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel to others. If we were to go back to Barcelona again, we would have no hesitation in booking the HBC again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & great rooms”
Reviews.Author: playaka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance to everything, has a very refreshing pool after a long day of walking, spacious / quiet / comfortable rooms. What else can you ask for? We loved the complimentary 1hr walking tour of the area - nice touch! Staff was not very engaging, but if that's not your priority, you'll love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay on the weekend!”
Reviews.Author: SKim78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a Tuesday to Sunday and loved it at first. The rooms were a fairly decent size for Spanish standards and were nice enough. The roof pool area was nice and we never had trouble getting a lounger. However, when the weekend comes the hotel has a beautiful outdoor bar/lounge space that they open up to the public and it goes on until the wee hours of the morning. We had to wake up at 6am to make our train for Sunday morning and weren't able to sleep all night on account of the noise that kept going until well after 3am. Hotel Pros: decent sized room nice rooftop & infinity pool terrific location Hotel Cons: Far too noisy on the weekend water damage in bathroom plumbing problems, i.e. whenever a nearby unit flushed their toilet or ran their shower, the water would run through the pipes and it sounded like little bugs scurrying across the ceiling

Reviews.Title: “it was a super hotel better than expected”
Reviews.Author: mathias h
Reviews.Content: it was at great stay and super location 10-15 mins walk from very nice beach great with the pool on the roof and thte lounge was cool to

Reviews.Title: “Chic yet friendly hotel in the heart of the Barrio Gótico”
Reviews.Author: Justice-Toronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, right in the heart of the old city -- but on a calm, quiet, mostly pedestrian street. It is clean and modern, as are the rooms -- which were well kept and had air conditioning, which was useful in August. The King bed was on the firm side. The rooftop pool was small but nice for a few lengths and chilling out at the end of the day. Finally, the desk staff were helpful with advice on restaurants and bars, and with setting us up with bicycles (kept on site) for a couple afternoons. The bikes were great for getting to the beach and Sagrada Familia, and exploring Gracia. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, so no comment on that. My one recommended area for improvement would be to make the wi-fi free, although the complimentary Internet-equipped computers off the lobby satisfied our needs just fine. All in all, we had an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “We are going back soon!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mariar1976
Reviews.Content: Lovely location for shopping, dining etc. Very helpful members of staff, clean with fantastic breakfast selection. I visited with my mother and i ll be going back soon with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Bernerlu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for my my wife's birthday treat, for ourselves and our 2 daughters and stayed in rooms 103 & 104, both rooms were modern, clean, well maintained and as promised next to each other. We arrived early and our rooms were not available, we left our luggage in the luggage room and had a quick look around the area, we returned at approx 1.30pm and the rooms had been made up for us, which is earlier than the normal check-in of 2.00pm. The Hotel is in a fabulous location 25mts from the Cathedral square, las Ramblas is only a 5 minute walk away, and the main shopping area is less than a minute. There are many good and some not so good Tapas bars very close by, we were recommended St Caterin's Cuines by one of the reception staff which is located in St caterins market, again about 5 minute from the Hotel, one word Superb ! . In general all the staff at the Hotel were very helpful and polite and we will be returning again, and would not hesitate to recommend to others. PS Pool and roof terrace very good on 5th floor

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, right in the heart of the gothic quarter”
Reviews.Author: SNUG982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with friends in this lovely hotel for a weekend in August. Neither couple could fault our stay. The rooms are large, air conditioned and spotlessly clean. We particularly loved the pool area which was a great bonus after a long day sightseeing in the August sun. The hotel is just of a very busy square but was very queit at night, we heard no outside noise at all. We really enjoyed our stay and when we return to Barcelona we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Pbrameld
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and chose the hotel based on the reviews and the location. I have to say it lived up to our expectations in every respect. I did have an issue with paying for the WiFi but the staff were very helpfulmand a compromise was reached. I had two devices and hence needed two log addresses as you can only log one device on to each assigned account. We would certainly stay there again and our stay was made very pleasant but the attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice but Host & Hostees were horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rho181
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the bath rooms were very large compared to most European bathrooms I've seen. Couldn't really watch tv because every channel was in Spanish but that's understandable since we were in Spain. BBC World News was the only English speaking channel, I heard other people found a cartoon channel but I also found EuroSports channel. The rooms were also quiet which was nice but we didn't spend most of the day in there. The only issue I had is that the shower again had half a door, that must be a popular thing in many European hotels but I hate that because water gets everywhere in the bathroom. The Host and Hostees at the front desk were completely unhelpful and actually ruinned one of our days. We asked them how to get to Cardonia which was 2 hours outside of the city, we wanted to see the country side with a castle in that area. They gave us the wrong information, first they told us the wrong bus and the wrong time. We asked if the Castle was open on weekends because usually they are limited hours or closed on weekends...they told yes. After we got to the bus station on Sat. we were told we were told the wrong bus, we found the right bus but they didn't leave at 11am like we were told they leave at 1pm and the last bus coming back to Barcelona leaves at 530pm, giving us 30mins to look at the castle and country side. We decided not to do that which runined our whole day so we went on the double decked tour bus again which showed us the Sagrada Familiar that from our travelling book looked lame and we decided not to do it but from the tour bus when we saw the real thing it was absolutely amazing. The Host & Hostees didn't have any info about how to get where or what there was to do, they were completely unhelpful. If you decide to go to this hotel it is right next to the Catherdal church and several resturants around the corner and a 2-3 block walk to Las Ramblas with shops,resturants, and bars. Also do the Flamenco dancing show which is right on Las Ramblas. I was told the beach was at the end of Las Ramblas...that is a lie, the end of Las Ramblas will take you to the pier where there is a couple of resturants but you will have to walk about 5miles to get to the end where the beach is. We made that mistake in believing our hotel again. The beach is not like jamaica's beaches, it looks just like american beaches...light brown with trash on it but its packed when you go. The metro was a block away from our hotel which was nice and the Picasso Museum was a few more blocks away from our hotel about a 15min walk. The location was great because we were in the Gothic part of town which had a lot of old looking type buildings. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you need suggestions from the front desk. Go to this hotel for a convient stay but make sure you find out all the information about where to go on your own because they will give you wrong information or just say they don't know. No airport transportation but they will call a taxi for you in advanced and you can just stand in the taxi line to get a taxi there. they have a small refrigator but only room for one thing because they have drinks already in there that will be charged to the room if you open them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jackkk1
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the positive reviews it had received and I have to say it was a good decision. It is located in the heart of the Gotic quarter of the city, just a few steps from La Rambla, Cathedral, hop on hop off bus stop and even metro station and beach is nearby. The room wasn't extremely spacious but it was sufficient for us. As the hotel is new, the furniture wasn't worn at all, air conditioning worked perfectly and the bed was extremely comfortable. Despite all this there were some downsides, too. There is not very much storage space in the room and the bathroom door doesn't isolate noise at all so you can hear almost everything. Breakfast was delicious, however you have to order breakfast (except for sweet things and drinks) and there wasn't enough staff to deliver it so sometimes we just ate some croissants and pastries and left without being noticed. The sweet thing were really delicious, though. There are 3 computers in the lobby if you need to connect for free, otherwise you have to pay for the internet. The small pool on the roof was a great retreat from the street rush. The only problem was you don't get pool towels so you have to take one from the bathroom. All in all, we were completely satisfied with the hotel. Since it is a 4-star hotel, I will give it 5/5 despite the little flaws which I think can be expected from a 4-star property for a very decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and great pool”
Reviews.Author: joby69
Reviews.Content: As previously said, this hotel was great in terms of central location with everything in easy walking distance. We arrived very early having just been on a cruise and our room wasn't ready but the staff were happy for us to use the pool and complimentary internet or sit in the outside lounge area. We had a very nice, modern room and the hotel overall was very clean. The pool on the roof was excellent and ideal for relaxing around (some people comment negatively about the pool and the view overlooking other buildings but this is typical of Barcelona)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: 2572dave
Reviews.Content: Hotel was centrally located in the Gothic quarter and close to the tourist areas of Las Ramblas and Port Olyimpic. Rooms were clean and spacious, all facilities provided if needed (toothbrush, shower gel etc). Breakfast was great and service as well. Receptionists very friendly and speak good english. Roof terrace was ideal and private but small.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Diane94941
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barcelona Catedral was terrific. The hotel is handsome, the rooms are modern, clean comfortable with great beds. I was there with my husband and 3 children. We had adjoining rooms, which worked out perfectly with the addition of a cot. There was a nice pool on the roof deck (necessary after warm days sightseeing) and a gym that while basic, has enough for a vacation workout. The breakfasts were large and they did everything possible to accommodate us. The free access to computers in the lobby was a plus. You can't beat the location. It's on the main square, but is just around the corner, so you have a bit more privacy. You're walking distance to literally everything you want - including the metro! We loved this hotel, recommend it and would definitely stay here again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: LMBittick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the night preceding a cruise. We wanted to do a bit of sightseeing and have a quiet place to catch up on our rest before the sip’s departure. The hotel exceeded our expectations-- the staff went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable. The hotel is very close to the Plaça de la Catedral (Barcelona Cathedral), but not directly on top of the square, which minimizes activity around the hotel building (a plus). Plaça Catalunya and La Rambla are both a short stroll away. When turning in for the night, noise from the cafe across the street was unusually loud. After checking the full-length window, I found one of the internal latches at the top was not working properly, leaving a gap (allowing noise to penetrate the room). We informed the desk and they had a new room ready within 10 minutes. There is a free business center with computer terminals. Wi-Fi is available, but it is not free. For our short stay this was not an issue. A nice bonus: there is a hotel-provided tour of the Gothic Quarter every Saturday morning, which fit our schedule and was very informative. The hotel also has bicycles available for check-out... a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: gilbertos303631
Reviews.Content: we stayed at two connecting rooms for four nights (two adults,two kids) the hotel is nice ,but overpriced rooms are clean and well decorated nice location if you are planning to stay at the gottic neighbourhood we tried breakfest buffet but we rather starbucks just one around the catedral plaza

Reviews.Title: “perfecto”
Reviews.Author: goldfish40
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel in top location. Staff is very professional, friendly and helpful. Our room and bathroom were spacious and clean and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was fantastic - especially if you like yummy cakes! There are lots of shops and restaurants close by, the Rambla in short walking distance, public transport is close - altogether the perfect place to stay! Good value for money! PS: Babia Tavern across the road makes top tapas!

Reviews.Title: “Modern design, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: MariannaMiamibeach
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel with great customer service. The only frustration we had was finding it- we were walking around in circles for a while so make sure you ask for very detailed directions from the hotel if you are arriving there by train. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: ghafsaas
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Its very clean, and have a very good design. My room was spacious and I slept well in my bed. Its situated in the middle of the old city and has lots of nice shops and restaurants right around the corner, What I found a bit annoying was that I had to pay for internet-access. When I stay at a top end hotel like this, witch also was a bit expensive, I expect internet-access to be included.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Daisybeegood
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a hotel we will return to again if we are in Barcelona. The only thing I would do differently is to use either bus or train to get there as it not the easiest place to access in a car as it wasn't on our sat-nav & we ended up travelling down some very tight cobbled streets to get there. Our bathroom was the nicest I have ever seen, the beds were firm but nonetheless extremely comfortable, we didn't partake of the tea/coffee option in the room as we felt a charge of 1.50 Euro per pack was a bit ridiculous, especially since there was unlimited wine / cava as part of the breakfast buffet. Our breakfast was served in the outdoor, covered terrace & we arrived down to a tray of fresh breads, croissants, jams etc, coffee was brought to our table & we had a full menu for cooked items as well as a full buffet selection including fruit, delicious cakes, juices & wine/cava, all included as part of our booking. The staff were lovely & very helpful too, we would throughly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it. Close to Rambla, metro, shops, museums, etc.”
Reviews.Author: 38katelane
Reviews.Content: Great rooms. Pool on rooftop. Nice concierge. Free Internet in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic situation”
Reviews.Author: caz_jw
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault the location, the comfort or the staff - all absolutely first class. One of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in! I did, however, feel it was a little petty to be expected to pay for tea and coffee sachets in the room. Also would have appreciated a mini bar price list to avoid nasty shocks on check out!! Breakfast over priced too. Having said that, it is nice to splash out from time to time. Would recommend for anyone staying for more than a few days - we only stayed one night and didn't really have the chance to use all of the facilities (spa, pool etc).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, beds are HARD"”
Reviews.Author: jlbussman
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on the reviews that were already posted and couldn't agree with them more. We stayed here for the first leg of our honeymoon and absolutely enjoyed our stay. The staff was mostly helpful. One or two members of the staff didn't understand English that well, but everyone else was fabulous. One of them gave us great "local" food recommendations. The only downside was that the beds were HARD. We were there for four nights and after the first night, both of us were sore from how hard the beds were. It got better as our bodies adjusted, but the first night was brutal. As mentioned in other reviews, they provided us with a complementary bottle of cava because we had told them that we were on our honeymoon. Highly recommended overall..

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel in an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: keenercam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Barcelona Catedral from June 26 to June 29. From the time we arrived, the front-desk staff were friendly, helpful and attentive. Everyone spoke English and greeted us with a smile when any of us went past the desk. The location is ideal, right next to the Barcelona Cathedral and a 2 minute walk to Las Ramblas. The proximity to Las Ramblas was ideal without having to worry about the noise and commotion/congestion prevalent there. We were a very quick walk away from lots of places to eat and the tourist bus. The hotel itself is bright and airy. Truly refreshing after a day in the hot sun, exploring the city. It's location on a quiet side street is ideal. The rooms were comfortable and spotlessly clean. We were fortunate enough to have 2 rooms right next to each other as we were travelling with our 23 year old and 18 year old "children". The wireless internet access just off the lobby was very convenient and we never had to wait long for access to one of the three terminals there. The recommendation by the front desk staff for a dinner buffet/flamenco dancing show was appreciated. The dinner and show were excellent and we likely would not have thought to experience that without the recommendation. The rooftop pool was great. The space for loungers is somewhat limited but the area is pleasant and I didn't mind sitting at the pool's edge until a lounger became available. The view from up there is wonderful! We did not eat at the restaurant in the hotel but it looked very nice. We would certainly stay at this hotel again. We loved the location and the friendly people there. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a few glitches.”
Reviews.Author: Palman13
Reviews.Content: We found the Catedral through Trip Advisor. It is a well located hotel that is a pretty fair value. The room we occupied was on the 5th floor next to the pool and exercise area. The room was large in comparison to most typical European hotels, very modern and updated. The bed was comfortable and had a good sitting area with desk and sofa. A couple of the frustrations: There was no full length mirror, when you left the room the key turned off the electric service but also the a/c so it took some time to cool back down on warm days: but the biggest frustration was the WiFi service, beside a 10€ daily charge, it didn't work in the room so I would have to go down to lobby to get connected. Overall a nice hotel, in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “great location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: miniwoo
Reviews.Content: the hotel is literally right next to the cathedral. it is the perfect location for walking and exploring barcelona. easy walk to all the sites and in a quiet area. the ramblas is only a couple blocks away; across the main street and down 2 blocks is the riberia area with great restaurant choices. use the complimentary bikes from the hotel to ride down to the beach. modern art museum and prado museum are about 5 blocks. the amenities at the hotel are great, everything you need, modern and clean. beds are a real queen bed, not 2 small beds pushed together. we had no issues with the room. free internet from computers in the lobby area, however there is a daily fee if you would like to use wifi in your room. highly recommend going on the complimentary night tour of the gothic area offered by the hotel; we already explored barcelona for 3 days and still found the tour interesting. closest metro is 3 about 2 blocks away; easy walk. we were on our honeymoon but would definitely stay at the catedral again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: FeeGrant
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel for a long weekend to celebrate our joint 40th birthdays. Although the service and the main reception dask was polite but average, the rest of the staff, especially in the bar and restaurant area, were lovely and made us feel very welcome. Nothing was too much trouble. Our room was spacious, clean and what I would expect from a four star. The bed was huge! The hotel's location was a 2 minute walk from Las Ramblas and perfectly situated to go exploring. The roof top pool was small but clean and suited our needs; to cool off after a sunbathing session. There were not a lot of beds, but we went later in the afternoon so it wasn't a problem. If we ever return to this lovely city, I would not hesitate in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Yep...still the best in Barcelona!!!”
Reviews.Author: wclegends
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went back to this great hotel for a second time (see our 2009 review), and weren't disappointed. It's location is perfect and is the service and rooms. Just a wonderful place to stay in Barcelona. In fact, we just booked it again for November, 2011. The very large and always busy plaza and very close tapas restaurants are wonderful, and the closeness to Las Ramblas with all its great stores is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: pblumax
Reviews.Content: The room we had for three people was big in comparison to other Europe hotel rooms. Our room even had an additional sofa and center table. The bathroom was luxurious and spacious. The hotel is on a side street though and returning to the hotel at night was of concern to all of us. There is another hotel on the opposite side of the plaza that is better situated. Also, Hotel Barcelona Catedral does not have an attractive lobby where one can rest after walking in the area. This hotel also charged us a full continental breakfast (18 euros) when my son was only able to drink a glass of juice because his scheduled tour was leaving. Even though my husband cancelled the order and explained the situation, he was still charged for a full meal. I would also like to mention that the room rate we paid was of 230 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great location, very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: palitigate
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. Overall, it was a great experience. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, spoke perfect english, and met all of my needs. The room was clean, and included a very nice bathroom, large TV, and plenty of extras. The only downside was the hardness of the bed, which others had noted on tripadvisor. The bed is very hard, but I was so tired from the time difference, I slept just fine. The location is perfect. You are very close to the Cathedral and square and there is a lot happening. Bring earplugs if there is a holiday or event happening late night on the square. I was there during a holiday and fireworks were going on until about 1:00 AM. Overall, a great place to stay, and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we`ll back”
Reviews.Author: 6155helmut
Reviews.Content: The PLA-restaurant in theGothic quater was excellent and also the Miramar restaurant and club downstairs the cable car at Mount Juic

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, but missed internet in room”
Reviews.Author: RuthyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel,situated right across the Barcelona Cathedral. The rooms are great, the place is extremely clean and the staff is fabulous. The only downside is that even if you are willing to pay for wi fi in your room, the signal is weak and Ipads or Mac notebooks cannot get the signal. Also you would have to pay $10 every 24 hours per computer, so if you and your companion have two iPads if you were able to get wi fi, it would cost you $20 per 24 hours. The hotel has two working computers free in the lobby, but in this day and age it is not enough. That is the only reason for giving it 4 instead if 5 in my rating.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeflaw567
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a terrific four night stay at the Barcelona Catedral Hotel. I must admit that it did not look promising when we arrived early in the morning to find nobody at the front door to assist us with our luggage. However, the minute we went to the front desk, somebody appeared to offer assistance. Our room was available for early check-in, and a bellhop took our luggage up. The room was surprisingly large, with a nice sized bathroom having quality amenities. The location is just perfect for touring, being walking distance to most tourist sites. There is a rooftop swimming pool, which looked very appealing. The staff spoke English, and was very helpful, especially Soroya Bella behind the desk, who helped us plan our sightseeing for the day. Our room rate included breakfast, and the breakfast was very good. We loved the hotel, and would definitely go there the next time we are in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: fiona73
Reviews.Content: myself and my husband went here for his 40th birthday, like previous people have said, the location is fantastic and so is the breakfast, i had it prebooked through travel republic, staff were very good in helping us with getting our boarding passes printed, the rooms were gorgeous, loved the firm bed and the bathroom was really big compared to most hotels. all in all we had a great time

Reviews.Title: “City Break and Gothic Quarter Tour”
Reviews.Author: kendo62
Reviews.Content: Highly recommeded hote for couples with ideal location slap bang in the middle of the gothic quarter just off the cathedral square. The hotel was spotless and suprisingly quiet with excellent food and an excellent not to be missed breakfast. The hotel do a free walking tour round the gothic quarter on Sunday and Tues morning at 10am not to be missed as the local guide is very informative and will show you sights you would normally miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Gonetroppo59
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. Not that big yet big enough not to have to avoid people at every turn. Rooms are spacious and quite modern. Roof top pool was cool but refreshing on a hot day (some construction still going on here but no inconvenience). Pretty little coutyard as well to sit outside and have a drink.
