Most pleasing aspect was it's location. Right in the “Ciutat Vella” (old town or Gothic Quarter), right next to the Barcelona Cathedral and Via Laietana. Step outside and the open square awaits with performers on certain days and little lane ways that head off in all directions, each one with incredible history but full of shops of all sorts to just wander and shop. A walking tour is well worth it here and this hotel sometimes arranges these for free. Satff were always courteous. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I would return in a heart-beat”
Reviews.Author: Lexvettegirl
Reviews.Content: In our opinion, this hotel earned its TripAdvisor Accolades. It was in a great location. Our room was quiet, clean and comfortable. The covered patio ("chill out") was lovely and a nice place to relax with a glass of cava after walking all day. The included breakfast was amazing and the staff were all very helpful and friendly. My only critique is that the restaurant was closed on the weekend and had we known that, we would have pre-booked the first night we were there. Oh, and the bed is a bit too firm, but we found that condition throughout Spain.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are right on”
Reviews.Author: fig414
Reviews.Content: The best part was the price compared to others. The location cannot be beaten. Rambla is close and so is Plaza Cataluna. Do the Hop On/Hop Off your first day to decide whether you want to cab for bus to Montjuic and the Gaudi stuff. The rooms are very cool and big. Breakfast is great but way over priced at 18 Euro but they don't do breakfast in Barca at all like the USA. Your choice. The pool was a very nice perk. This hotel is a can't miss.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Canyonlands2008
Reviews.Content: stayed four nights in the Hotel Barcelona Catedral. Location is right in the historic ("gothic") quarter of the city. Just at the place before the Cathedral. The historic Cathedral, that should not be mixed with the famous "Sagrada Familia", which is a little further away. Las Ramblas and the harbour were only a short walk. The next subway is at Plaza Catalunya which was about 5-10 minutes walk. Booked on the website. Check-In was friendly and fast. Check-in is at 4 om but my room was ready at 11 am. The hotel is very new and the room was quite large with a very large bath room (full bath with shower) The bed was little to hard for me, caused me some back pains. Continental Breakfast is inlcuded in the room rate. Quality was good. I can only recommend the Hotel Barcelona Catedral for any visit to Barcelona. Cant comment on the restaurant as there were far too many other options around. WIFI was offered for about 10 € per day. Strange was that sometimes my Ipad had Internet without any signup. Nice but i guess not intended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location lovely modern rooms!”
Reviews.Author: marzzie18
Reviews.Content: It's located right in the heart of the gothic quarter so was handy for walking or catching the subway. The rooms were really nice and clean, nice modern decor and the bathroom was spacious and clean!

Reviews.Title: “Glad We Stayed!”
Reviews.Author: EduardTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed in May 2011. Upon arrival from US mid morning, our room wasn't available (no surprise) but they offered to store our bags and the use of a large restroom on the lower level. Within 15 minutes we were walking around Barcelona. Excellent reception. When we returned mid-afternoon our room was ready. The room was great. Plenty of space, comfortable bed and excellent bathroom. Very clean. Breakfast was good and convenient but a bit expensive for what you get. Not sure I would get it again but the convenience was nice. As others have reviewed, there is free internet terminals in the lobby. The pay for wireless (10 Euro/day) is spotty. Great location to visit Barcelona and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. A real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ElizaDrum
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay at the Hotel Barcelona Catedral. We were three women travelling and had booked a triple room - basically a corner double room with an extra fold down bed. The room was a good size & had plenty of wardrobe space for three women - about a dozen hangers. The room was spotless as was the entire hotel. The bathroom was lovely and toiletries updated daily. Check in and out was quick & efficient. We had not booked breakfast (from previous reviews it seemed to be over priced) and we did not eat in the hotel. During our stay we did not see anyone eating in the evening. The bar area is relatively small but there are large stylish patio lounge areas which are pleasant if weather allows. There is a nice pool on the roof but weather unfortunately was not warm enough for us to use it but the area was nice & again spotless. There were a number of sun loungers there - around a dozen I would say. There are many restaurants within a short walking distance of the hotel & a lovely pastry shop for breakfast on the square next to the hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location in the Bari Gotic, a short stroll from Las Ramblas. The Cathedral is right next door. The Barcelona hop on bus tour has a stop within 2 minutes from the hotel and is a relatively quiet stop that gets you on the bus before the queues at Placa de Catalunya which was a bit of a bonus. I would recommend this hotel due its location & the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Super way to start our vacation in Spain!”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTravelerA_Z
Reviews.Content: Service was wonderful. When we arrived that morning before a room was available, they offered to keep our bags so we could go out and see the city. It was the perfect location and we walked to everything that we wanted to see! It was very clean and the restaurant was actually very good, too! I recommend putting on something nice and eat here at least once!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: mram18
Reviews.Content: We really liked the location of the hotel which was very near to las Ramblas. The hotel was nice and clean with lovely breakfast and very polite and helpful members of staff. We are definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: E Garvey
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed five nights at the Barcelona Cathedral Hotel and we enjoyed our stay. I agree with others when they stated that the breakfast was over-priced, we had one breakfast - two fried eggs (served in the small skillet they were cooked on, with two rashers one small tomato and one mushroom piled on top) - but you don't have to eat there, plenty of places nearby. The hotel was very clean and staff who a very willing to help, Wi-Fi doesn't work in the upper rooms, but there are free to use computers off the lobby downstairs. Would certainly recommend it for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: marymary077
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff at a great location. A nice hotel close to a market and next to the Barcelona Cathedral and in the historic Gothic area. The evening tour offered by the hotel is a really nice touch and take it in if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Catedral is a Great place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: skblut
Reviews.Content: I thought that this hotel was very nice .It was very clean and the rooms had comfortable beds with flat screen tv and the bathroom was very big and very nice.The location was perfect not far from the Picasso Museum and right near the Catedral very centrally located in a nice area.We left our bags at the desk no problems checking in or out of the hotel has wifi will give you a password they do charge for it.Has a restaurant adjoining for breakfast was a little expensive$$ though you get a buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: GemsCork
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I can’t believe it’s taken me so long to write this review. My husband and I are from Ireland and we got married in Barcelona last August. We spent a lot of time in the lead up to the wedding researching hotels in the city centre and Hotel Catedral was the only one which ticked all the boxes for us. From day 1 it was obvious that the hotel management & staff were going to be very easy to deal with. Nothing was ever a problem for them, no matter what we asked. We booked almost 100 rooms in the hotel for 4 or 5 days around our wedding and the professionalism from each and every one of the staff was second to none. I dealt alot with Núria, the receptionist, who looked after all of the initial bookings. She was excellent. I also dealt a lot with Susanna, the hotel's commercial director, who helped us plan a drinks reception for our guests the night before the wedding in their stunning & spacious terrace. Susanna too was brilliant and nothing was ever a problem for them. They were always just so pleasant to deal with, which made our lives so much easier in the build up to the wedding. For us the highlights were the friendly & helpful staff, the amazing breakfast, the quietness of the hotel despite its central location (right on the shopping street - Port del Angel, and directly opposite the Cathedral & walking distance to the Borne) and the swimming pool facility on the roof. As you can imagine with so many of our guests staying in the hotel we placed a lot of demands on the hotel staff both in the months leading up to our stay and for the duration of our stay. They went out of their way to facilitate us in every way. We will definitely choose to stay in this hotel whenever we return to Barcelona (which will be a regular occurrence) as will many of our guests...in fact, a few of them have already been back there and told us how great it was again. Thanks to everyone in the hotel for making it such a memorable few days for us!

Reviews.Title: “Without it, it could not be magic”
Reviews.Author: blouxx
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona Cathedral allowed us to have a magic trip in Barcelona: located in the middle of the Gothic Barcelona, old town, we enjoined our stay just as local citizens, walking and avoiding loosing time in useless transports. Of course the Barcelona Cathedral access map/indications to the hotel and to the car park could be better, but a simple call to its so gentle staff made us arrive really quickly thanks to their help: they went out of the hotel and conducted us to the parking (maybe a expensive but the whole town's parking is, and we could leave the car longer than expected freely as there were places left). Having indicated that we were with our baby in the reservation, we found a big quiet perfect room, and a very nice baby bed was already prepared for our daughter. During the whole stay, the staff has been always so pleasant, kind, and smiling. Yes the breakfast is expensive, but having a breakfast close to the hotel, in the old town, with high quality products is so easy, and made use enjoy a lot more our stay by feeling the sunny Barcelona morning wake.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: PhxRain
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Catedral very early on the morning of May 10, 2011 due to the fact that we had to be up at 5AM to be off of our cruise ship by 7AM. The cab took us right to the Hotel and the security guard on duty for the nights & early morning, let us in & we took our bags inside to check them in until we could check into our room later that morning. Really liked the idea of having a security guard monitoring the ins & outs of people at night. The Gentleman at the desk asked for our information & told us that they, in fact, had our room ready if we would like to go ahead and check in. We immediately said, "Yes, please!" and within minutes we were in the elevator headed to our room. It was still shy of 7AM so we dropped our luggage, crawled into bed and took a nap! When we awoke at 9AM, we had a chance to check out the room. It was nice, clean & large, with a large bathroom and soft towels. I could tell they wash their towels in a solution of vinegar & water sometimes because while drying off after a shower, you could smell a faint whiff of vinegar. But it was not overpowering and it did not linger long. The sheets were nice & the mattress was firm but all of the mattress' we've slept on in Europe have been firm and not very uncomfortable at all. In fact, after waking up in the mornings without a sore lower back, it made us think that we may need to get a firmer mattress for our bed once we got home. You could make coffee in your room for 1euro 50cents for each cup used but we decided to walk less than 50 yards to the nearest cafe for a cappuccino or 100 yards for a Starbucks coffee or cappuccino. Later that day, we decided to use their free internet to check into our flight the next day. They explained that they do not have a printer on the free computers but to save the boarding passes onto the desktop, then access your e-mail, attach the passes to the e-mail & send it to the hotels e-mail address then they print it out in their office. Well the browser functions are in Spanish so when I got to that point, one of the nice gentlemen at the desk came over to help me. It wasn't sending the barcode to be scanned at the airline gates so he tried it on his own with the same result. So the other gentleman at the desk said that since I was already checked in for the flight, that he would go ahead & use my confirmation # to access the passes & print them out directly. He did that for us and in a few minutes time, we had our boarding passes in our hands for our flight the next day. They were extremely helpful and went above & beyond what they needed to do in order to help us & we thanked them both for their time & help. The location of the hotel is fantastic! You walk out the sliding glass doors, turn left and in 100 feet, you are at the Cathdral square. Then the next block to the right of the hotels street, you walk down there and within 2 blocks you are at the Las Rambla. And the noise was really not a factor in our location. We faced a small side street but the traffic and pedestrian noise never got loud at all. We cannot comment on the restaurants since we did not eat at any of them but with the location, rooms and price we would look into staying at this hotel again if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “top class hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Louise023
Reviews.Content: we spent 5 nights at this fabulous hotel. Im delighted we made the right choice as we`ve not been to Barcelona before. The location is spot on , 5 minutes walk from airport bus stop at Pl. Catalunya. Silent room at night time with the window closed. The bed was huge and very comfy, bathroom brand new and spacious. The cleaning ladies did a wonderful job every morning. We had an inclusive very good deal with breakfast which I found on the internet., so glad I did because breakfast was superb and the staff delightful and they worked so efficiently. So this is the place to stay, full marks to all the team....faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wear73
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona Cathedral is in a great central location near to the old town with plenty of restaurants around the area. The hotel is very clean and the breakfast was well worth the money as you could eat as much as you wanted. We stayed in a superior room which was spacious and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. and overall had a great four days short break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fletch73
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff, rooms are excellent and the location is central AND quiet thanks to a clever courtyard design.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Islandmagee
Reviews.Content: Very helpful, polite and attentive staff. Breakfast excellent but as we did not want to eat a huge meal every morning we were happy to have a coffee and croissant at a local cafe. Had a snack at lunchtime in the bar. The sandwich was lovely and service great. The room was noisy at night and in the morning due to the comings and goings of the street but if the windows were closed the double glazing eliminated noise completely. The location of the hotel was definitely its biggest asset, right in the heart of the barri gotic. We went on the Wednesday evening tour, provided by the hotel for guests at no charge. This was a highlight and made the following days more interesting as we had gained an insight into our surroundings we would not have had otherwise. We would definitely recommend this hotel. Only tip would be to request a double bed prior to arrival and to check at the front desk that this has been allocated. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: eleniaggeliki
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of Bari Gotic but tucked away from the hassle and bustle of the Catedral Square. Although I specifically asked for a room with a double bed, we were given one with a twin bed. I immediately called the reception to ask for a change of room and they told me that they'd look if there was another available but in the meantime I wasn't to touch anything in that room! OK, it was a reasonable request but it still sounded funny. We were shown to a room with a double bed but the floor looked like it hadn't been swept for a while and the loo like it had been used and not cleaned afterwards. There were distinctive spots on the floor right in front of it... Too tired to make a fuss, I cleaned it myself! Also, the closet space was tiny. Enough room to hang our jackets and nothing more. In every room there are informative brochures about the hotel's services and in one of them I read that the hotel provides guests with complimentary bicycles upon request so in the evening I asked the receptionist if we could have two for the next day. The lad on the desk wanted to rent them to me but when I pointed out that in the brochure it said that there was no extra cost for bikes, he said that he would have to talk to "somebody" about The particular "somebody" came and gave us the bikes for no extra cost. After that, they kept them in the store room behind the front desk every night because we used them during our entire stay. Very nice of them. Breakfast was alla carte and with not much variety so after a few days it became boring. Upon check in, the young lady at the front desk forgot to give us a map of the city and had to ask for one myself, not sure whether there was extra charge or not. On our check out day, they accepted quite eagerly to keep our luggage for us until the afternoon which was really helpful but when we asked for directions to a place that we couldn't locate ourselves as Bari Gotic is quite complex, the guy at the front desk didn't know and looked it up on the internet. I could have done that myself. Should they have more detailed resources? In the end, he didn't find what we were looking for. The staff didn't seem very professional or knowledgeable of their city. On the other hand they were polite. To sum up, if you find a room in this hotel for 100 euros or less, book it. Doesn't worth more.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary staff”
Reviews.Author: mcgrathmary
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of the hotel. The staff is what really stands out about this particular hotel. They went beyond our basic needs and questions and assisted us handle a difficult situation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: julieann992
Reviews.Content: We went on our honeymoon to Barcelona March 19-28, and stayed at the Barcelona Catedral Hotel. We could not have been more pleased. We got to the hotel at 8am or so, and even though check in was not until noon, they had a room ready for us in under a half hour. When we first walked into our room, the staff had set up a bottle of champagne, two glasses, and a nice note, welcoming us as honeymooners. The room was newly renovated and very clean, comfortable bed (though firm, which is my preference anyway), gorgeous large bathroom, and ample closet space. The room had its own safe, which was extremely helpful as we never wanted to carry around credit cards or passports (for fear of pickpockets). The location was superb, on the main square of the old historic cathedral. We loved being in the middle of the action of Old Barcelona, but sometimes it was noisy at night becuase of bars in the area (which we didn't mind, but I assume would bother some people...when the window was closed, it blocked the noise quite well). There was always something going on in the square outside the hotel, parades, people dancing, antique sales. The location was very centralized, with 3 metro stops close by - we were able to take the metro everywhere with no trouble for very cheap cost. The AeroBus, which is a bus that takes you to and from the airport (there's a bus for each airport terminal, be sure to get on the right one), has a stop at Placa Catalunya, which is a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel and was very convenient. We were there when it was 50-60 degrees fahrenheit, so we would just open the window in the room if we needed air, and didn't touch the thermostat. We loved the roof deck and would go sit out there and drink wine, but it was too cold to swim. We also used the computers downstairs which were very convenient for internet access....we could usually find one open, so we didn't do the in-room Wifi. We didn't eat at the 4 Capellans restaurant downstairs or do any room service, because it seemed expensive and we found some wonderful pastry places nearby to grab something and go. We were at the hotel for 9 days, and every staff person we spoke with spoke great English and there were no communication issues. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very good, friendly hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jandbsev
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in the hotel. The first night we didn't sleep much because our room was on the 4th floor which is one of 2 floors where smoking is allowed and the atmosphere in the room made one of us cough continuously. The next day we asked to be moved and we were allocated another room on a non smoking floor within the hour and with no problem at all. The room was large, modern and kept spotless by the housekeeping staff. Breakfasts were excellent and suited us perfectly. The reception staff were professional and extremely helpful We enjoyed the free Sunday walk with a very good official guide who showed us lots of things in the old city that we would never have found by ourselves. At the time of the walk, it was raining and a member of the reception staff smilingly handed out umbrellas for us to borrow. We thought that the location of the hotel, right next to the Catedral and a minute or two from The Ramblas and shopping areas was great, but although the hotel was right in the centre of things, it was very quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - would definately recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Florence123London
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at the Barcelona Catedral Hotel and had a fantastic stay. Although we arrived a couple of hours early, our room was already ready for us. The room was a good size, with an enormous bed. The bathroom was clean and modern, with a great selection of toiletries (including toothbrush, razor and face wipes!). The hotel itself is ideally located for exploring Barcelona, and there are numerous bars and restaurants nearby. We were pleased that we chose this hotel rather than one on La Ramblas! The staff on reception were very friendly and helpful. There are three computers in the reception area that you can use the internet on without any charge. They also offer complimentary cycle hire, which is a brilliant way to explore Barcelona. Breakfast was also good - although we went through Laterooms and got breakfast included - I wouldn't have paid 18 euros each for it! In summary, we would definately recommend the Barcelona Catedral Hotel and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: pat1187
Reviews.Content: great location,decent quality but a lot of little annoyances compared to other hotels we haved stayed in,for example,charging for saches of coffee in room,difficult television menu,not least lack of english channels only two news channels that worked. Biggest problem for myself was very uncomfortable chair ( one ) in room.

Reviews.Title: “The location, cleanliness and ambiance is perfectly complemented by an exceptional staff!”
Reviews.Author: Dick1013
Reviews.Content: We had three generations of family staying at the hotel and really enjoyed our visit. The hotel is contemporary and clean, and the location is ideal. However, it was the staff's friendliness and helpfulness that really enhanced our experience. If there was one recommendation I would offer to others it would be to seek out breakfast from the many surrounding eateries to get the best value. Great hotel to stay at and I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrs_snuffles
Reviews.Content: Mr Snuffles is quite fussy when it comes to hotels, but the Barcelona Catedral gets the thumbs up. The hotel is located in the heart of the old city, ideal for tourists but also good for business travellers looking to experience some Barcelona atmosphere. Bedrooms and bathrooms were spotlessly clean. Powerful shower and wooden floors in the bedroom (pluses so far as Mr Snuffles is concerned). The bed was a bit firm and there was some noise from the street. So for a good night's sleep you should choose a higher floor with a room away from the elevators (and one that is not part of an adjoining suite). Service was excellent, the front desk always willing to help. Internet charges are 10 euros per day per device (but if you ask nicely, they'll let you off the multiple devices charge). Good breakfast, especially if you like pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: natalya_garf1
Reviews.Content: We had a very plesant stay in this butifull hotel with top location in the center of Barcelona and will stay here during our possible next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: bannocks
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from a 3 day break to Barcelona staying at the Barcelona Catedral. Great hotel in a superb location with lots of great eating places on your doorstep. Room very comfortable - bathroom good with great shower. Continental breakfast was included in the rate we got with Alpha Rooms. Would not have paid for it otherwise as it was very expensive. Reception staff very helpful. Could not comment on the bar as we did not use it. Only 5 minutes from the airport bus at Placa Catalunya. Would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for first time to BCN”
Reviews.Author: BruggeBruges
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to confirm what we have been reading about the catedral BCN , we had a great time , all was perfect . The location in the old bario Gotic area is superb ! We e-maild prior to our stay to ask about some wellness facilities in town and the receptionist advised the roman baths in Born , called AIRE de barcelona , need to book ahead because it is so popular , and with reason ! After 3 days days walking our feet were killing us .... but not anymore after the Aire experience ! The receptionist at Catedral give you some maps and brochures on arrival , but afterwards not always present at the front .When you asked something they were very willing to help . The first step has to be taken by the guests ... I would prefer them to be a little less formal , but I assume that is the way they are thought to do in a 4 * . Will certainly return to BCN , with my teenaged daughters ... shopping next time !

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: j0nnybarfly
Reviews.Content: This is a well placed hotel a stone's throw from the cathedral and 2 minutes from La Ramblas and yet very quiet. We had interconnecting rooms with large windows making the rooms light and airy with large clean bathrooms. There was a flat screen TV but few free international channels but a lot of pay-per-view stuff. The breakfast was expensive so we ate at the local cafes, many of which offer breakfast for around 5 euros. I know it is a small niggle, but charging 1.50 euros for a couple of sachets of coffee was disappointing given the cost of the room-we brought our own. Overall, a nice quiet hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean & comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: cdmacme
Reviews.Content: My number one concern when planning my trip with my 13-year old son was safety. I was really pleased with the location of this hotel, as it was right off of the pleasantly busy cathedral square. I never felt we were at risk of the pickpocketing or worse while we were around the hotel area. The staff were not overly friendly, but certainly not unfriendly. My only gripe would be that the breakfast was not included in our reservation and was WAY overpriced. We went to the cafe Estruch for breakfast most days and were met by a smiling and attentive staff with reasonable prices in lieu of the hotel meal. One other small thing is that wifi costs extra. In this day and age it seems it should be available at no cost. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location/Friendly/Safe/Helpful/Uber Modern Decor/Large Room!”
Reviews.Author: amoreeena
Reviews.Content: Loved our 6 day stay at this perfect little gem of a hotel. Arrived Barcelona at 7:30 a.m. Arrived hotel (driver backed down narrow street to front door & bags unloaded!) by taxi at 8:30. We were warmly greeted & immediately shown to bright, sunny room. Room was large (by European standards!) & spotlessly clean. Comfortable queen bed. Sophisticated, neutral colors made room soothing after ea. long day of sightseeing. We had a quiet room overlooking (one wall all windows) a large, sunny interior courtyard. Sheer, floor to ceiling drapery under heavy (room darkening) drapery for complete privacy or filtered bright light. Big windows opened for air. Very large, built-in wardrobe with modern etched glass doors trimmed in light wood (with safe inside) held tons of clothing. Bath had wall of etched glass windows which could be opened for air & to clear steam from room after shower. Sparkling glass, chrome & stone floors made bath sleek & comfortable to use. Very large mirror on one wall. Very nice quality hand soap, body lotion, shower gels, shampoo, conditioner & shower cap provided in abundance. Outlets in bath & in room for charging iphones, ipods, e-readers & more. Plenty of big, thick white towels daily. Lots of hooks/towel bars in bath. We found breakfast to be a good value & huge time saver as we wanted to be out of the hotel by 8-8:30 ea. day & had no desire to hunt down early morning meal outside the hotel. Hotel breakfast was perfectly cooked scrambled eggs topped with mounds of Spanish "jamon"....not the fatty, thin bacon we find in the U.S. it was delicious & thick. Coffee & a great selection of fruits & pastry made it the perfect way to start our busy days. Front desk staff were consistently smiling, friendly & helpful. We walked to every thing we wanted to see in our time in the city except for a day trip to Montserrat & another day trip to Figueres to see Dali Museum. We enjoyed hearing La Seu Catedral (which was 1/2 block away) bells ea. day. Toured the catedral one afternoon & took beautiful photos from the roof top. Hotel Barcelona Catedral was a great find! Location was perfect! Staff was professional & responsive. Highly recommend this great property! Booked online at the hotel website. Cost was a bargain for location/helpful staff/breakfast & handsome, comfortable room. All our needs were met at this property. Received prompt email responses to three emailed queries after our booking was made. Sunny ea. day & completely uncrowded at sights we wanted to visit, January in Barcelona was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: need4travelnow
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location for exploring Barcelona. It's close to everything via foot! We walked to the beach, the wonderful market (boquira) every morning for breakfast and many other sites. We walked to and from the Airport Bus at Placa Cataluna and that was only a 10 minute walk. If you want to take the train out of town, it's a 15 minute walk to the station. Very simple. The rooms are decent size and the bathrooms are nice as well! There was plenty of clothes storage in the closet and the beds were comfortable. The front desk staff was great at giving directions and suggestions. It was a bit too cold to swim, however we did visit the roof deck to relax. We sat in the courtyard on a few occassions and had a drink from the bar. All of the staff was great. Our room faced the side street out back and there was minimal noise. They are doing construction across the street, but it was hardly noticed! Four families with young adults (ages 17-23) traveled and we all enjoyed the city and the hotel! We took a fabulous bike tour with Barcelona Ciclo Tours (ask for Elizabeth), we toured the city and she was wonderful! Lots of fun, everyone enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet haven in central location”
Reviews.Author: 186525Jane
Reviews.Content: The reception staff at this hotel are very helpful and pleasant. Breakfast is superb and served by helpful staff. Good location to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything. Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeR2011
Reviews.Content: I am sure there are other nice hotels in Barcelona. But rest assured. This one is realy nice, and walking distance to everything. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Palmer_7
Reviews.Content: We really felt that we had struck lucky with this hotel. The location was excellent. We got the Aerobus from the airport and the hotel was only a short walk from the Placa Catalunya. The room was very clean and modern with a very nice bathroom (powerful shower with plenty of hot water). I really liked the laminate flooring in the room which felt cleaner than the usual hotel carpet! The king size bed felt quite hard at first but was actually very comfortable. Breakfast had been included in our package (booked with Alpha Rooms) and was certainly plentiful with fruit, cereal, cooked breakfast choices, yogurts, breads, pastries and cakes all included. The hotel was right in the heart of the Barri Gotic and surrounded by excellent restaurants and shops. It was very close to La Rambla and not too far from the sea front. The only downsides - charging for tea / coffee in the room (take your own as you can use the kettle and mugs) and charging for WiFi. I would also have liked a mirror above the desk / dresser in the room. If I ever return to Barcelona I would choose to stay in the Hotel Barcelona Catedral again.

Reviews.Title: “would go back in a second”
Reviews.Author: youhaveaface
Reviews.Content: great hotel right in the midst of it all. great beds, shower was excellent, room was clean and good sized. no hesitation in recommending it. breakfast was good too.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: menton1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Catedral in December 2010.Great location right next to the old town. Hotel, very quiet and clean with very attentive service from the personnel

Reviews.Title: “Want to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: debs_gu
Reviews.Content: A stunning 5* boutique hotel-perfect location for all the sights & in immaculate condition. Rooms pristine & large enough for two people-travelled with my husband on a 5 day mini break in July 2010. Only groan is that the pool are on the rooftop is tiny with only 10 or so sunbeds-so when we had done all the sights on the 4th/5th day of our trip it was a bit of a struggle to find a sunbed to relax on-although I appreciate that this would not be an issue in the not so warm months. Perfect central location for all the sights & within walking distance of the marina & around the corner from las Ramblas-loved it all!! Lovely self service breakfast & excellent room service too.Beds & bathroom immaculate with beds having the best quality bedding. Want to go back again-perfect for a short stay break,3 days is not enough, but 5 days was perfect,will be returning again-soon I hope!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice central Hotel in Old Town”
Reviews.Author: lriversen
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this hotel. Flesk rooms and a friendly staff. The breakfeast was included and was very good. Free wifi in our room, safe, and a large bathroom with a bathtub. The hotel us very well situated for exploring the old town and el born.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for seeing the sights of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MJButler76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Catedral for three nights in November 2010 for my wife's birthday. The Hotel is a fantastic location only about 5 minutes walk from the Placa Catalunya which is where the Blue Airport bus can drop you if you so wish. From the hotel you are really close to La Rambla and the old Gothic quarter which is great for restaurants & bars in the evenings and for exploring during the day. You're probably about 10 to 15 minutes away from the Port / Marina area too. Metro's are close by at Placa Catalunya and Liceu (on Las Rambla) from those you can get to everything else you want to see in the city. Back to the hotel. The guys on reception where great, spoke English (which is great with my very poor Spanish), and where really helpful. We couldn't check in until around 1pm and having arrived at 11:45 ish we decided to sit back and have a beer in the courtyard than at around 12:30 the guys from reception remembered us and checked us in. Not difficult to remember us, but we didn't have to ask, so a tick in the box. The reception area downstairs was pretty comfortable with a little lounge area and the outside courtyard with some comfy sofas. The room was very nice and clean with a good size bathroom and wardrobe for clothes etc. There was a safe in the room (free), TV on the wall & a great big double bed. There were Tea & Coffee making facilities, but you had to pay 1.50 Euro to open the pack, so we didn't bother. On top of this was a stuffed to the brim minibar - it wasn't cheap but it was nice to have the option. Overall if we were visiting Barcelona again we'd stay at the Hotel Catedral for a second time, we really liked it for it's location and it was different to your bog standard chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: piegirl52
Reviews.Content: Fantastically well-located hotel with rooms that were very clean and funtional but certainly not exceptional. We loved that the Cathedral was literally around the corner, and we were within 10 mins walking distance of Las Ramblas, Plaza Catalunya, El Born, and just about enything in the Gothic Quarter. The "hop-on, hop-off" bus stop was also right around the corner which was very convenient - the whole area was just charming and had lots of shops & dining options. The hotel itself was perfectly fine, just nothing special. Beds weren't all that comfortable, but again, rooms were very clean and functional (great shower & huge soft towels!) and it was nice & quiet. Common areas were nice. We did the package that included breakfast - not worth it (breakfast was ok, but overpriced for what it was -save your $$$ for a great dinner and grab something at LaBoqueria market or a Starbucks 5 minutes away). Special note that Jordi at the front desk was super-nice & helpful. Overall a good stay & would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. No problems at all.”
Reviews.Author: LucyMadrid
Reviews.Content: Just back from Barcelona. This hotel was a great choice. We had no problems with staff at all. We were able to check in early. Got a room on the smoking floor and we are non smokers but we were told it would be no problem to change us but they were confident it did not smell. And the room and the floor did not smell of tobacco at all. Perfect spot for a weekend as close to all the tourist sights or well connected Metro. The only thing is that I would have preferred more light in the room and a full length mirror in the room.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for a traveler in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: alinux
Reviews.Content: Excellent location if you are interested for city tour (close to the Barcelona official city tour by bus) and shopping. Close to the shore and Rambla Street. Friendly faces in the restaurant and reception and rooms are very clean. If I go for the second time in Barcelona I want to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Batofamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to its 4* rating, nicely fitted out with comfortably rooms. All hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic for sightseeing and walking about in an evening. Even though you are centrally based it wasn't too noisy at night. Breakfast was good quality and there is lots to choose from but try and get it included in your hotel deal as E18.50 is a little steep. Small roof top terrace good for a bit of relalaxtion at the end of a busy day, pool small but functional one tiny problem - its freezing! Take your own teabags so you can use kettle in room without having to pay E1.50 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kenhildi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean, spacious and the bathroom had everything we needed (shampoo, hair-dryer, new towels every day etc.). The bed was a little hard, but that is the only negative comment we have. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel. The location is perfect, close to the Cathedral and the Rambla, and still very quiet. We had a room facing the back, but the font of the hotel also seems quiet compared to other hotels in the same area. Taxi from the airport cost about 30 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star but the Pool was a Plus!”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Mom0222
Reviews.Content: Check-in is at 2pm and when we arrived at 3pm our room was not available. After receiving a complimentary drink at the bar while we waited for our room, we entered a very very warm small room. The room requires a room key to activate the electricity so we waited for 30 minutes before calling the front desk about the AC. We asked for another room thinking the AC wasn't working but they sent the maintenance man instead. He stuck a thermometer in the AC vent and waited 10 minutes before telling us the AC was working fine. We're very experienced travelers and yes the AC in Europe very often is not like the AC at home. However, the AC in this room was barely working. Too tired to make a scene, we took a nap. We woke to hear music from the hotel lounge below. With the window closed, we could hear the music in the morning, afternoon, and evening. Strangely, we could also hear the toilet flush from another room. The room was small; no lounge chair just footstools and a desk chair. The room was clean and mattress average/hard. The lighting in our room was very dark; there was no overhead fixture. Just spot lights above the bed and a desk light. If we hadn't been exhausted from touring around, sleeping would have been a problem between the lack of AC and noise. There was one front desk attendant that was very helpful, the others not so much. Breakfast was yummy; a nice selection of breads, good coffee, and the option to order anything from the menu was incuded as well as the buffet items. The hotel location is very central; around the corner from the old Cathedral, 5 minutes from Rambalas, 10 minutes to Catalunya Plaza. The pool was the saving grace; a roof top escape. Only one of the four computers worked in the business center.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lally63
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Barcelona so we picked this hotel for it's location which was perfect for getting to all parts of the city and easy to walk to if you get the bus from the airport. The breakfast was good and the staff were friendly the room was well modernised and very clean. The hotel had bikes which you could use free of charge to explore the city which seems to be a very popular way to explore. I would definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff absolutely rude and hotel less than perfect”
Reviews.Author: loveeurope1
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations based on other travelers reviews, even though there were those reviews with lesser ratings and now we would have agree that it is less than perfect. If there were a way to contact the hotel manager, we would have done it. Front desk staff were less than pleasant which could have ruined the entire trip to Barcelona. The hotel was nice in a good location however the staff and the lack of service was horrible. The room they gave us first was smoking which they guaranteed as a non smoking room. Then when finally they gave us a room, it was the smallest room possible and then stated there were no other rooms available. This hotel experience was one of the worst and we have travelled to England, France, Italy, and Spain in the past. Redeeming: Joan the night reception person was the only one that was nice, provided information that was correct and set a good example of a front desk employee. The other day employees gave wrong information, did not have train or bus schedules or any ideas of restaurants except those close by. The internet although free is open to any one who happens to be in the hotel, even non paying guests. It is in a location way to convenient for those who think they have the right just because they are there as a wedding rececption guest or other. Also when they were approached to not use the internet, they became extremely vocally rude to us paying guest s of which the front desk clerks did absolutely nothing again.. We left a day early because of the rudeness. of the staff. Would I recommend this hotel, maybe only for location if visiting Barcelona as this hotel is close to old town. If you can deal with rudeness go for it, there are other hotel options in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want and need”
Reviews.Author: DRLANCS
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend anybody travelling to Barcelona to stay at this hotel , it was our first time in Barcelona and this hotel made a cracking first impression. The hotel is modern, clean and has good facilities from the chill out area to the swimming pool terrace. GOOD POINTS -Excellent location across from the cathedral on a side street thats away from the all the busyness. But yet only 5 minutes walk to La Rambla. -The chill out area (when available) was a grat place to spend time, with comfy seating and relaxing music, great place to relax with a bottle of wine! -The pool and sundbathing area was a good sun trap and extremly peaceful, no road noise or noise at all!! -Clean and good sized modern bedrooms. -Big comfy beds. -Good service on arrival, we were taken to and shown around the room, he also showed us how to work the air con and safe. -Free Safe in your room. -Fresh towels daily. -Free Computers with internet access in the hotel reception. Although the hotel has plenty of good points, it does have bad ones too, although the goods definatley outweigh the bads! BAD POINTS - Although there is a nice pool, its too cold to swim in! Ice Cold! -Can not believe you have to pay for t.v, wi-fi, tea and coffee. -Was very dissapointed that at the weekend we were told we could not use the chill out area (a good selling point to me about this hotel).. This was due to private functions (weddings). A bit dissapointing when its something you have paid for use of. And not only could you not use it, you had to listen to the noise in your room till late. We did fill in a suggestions scheme and the hotel responded very quickly. If i was to return i would definetly return to this hotel without a second thought, perfect allrounder!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing modern hotel right in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: harris2285
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned about staying so close to Las Ramblas as we had heard all the mugging and pick-pocketing horror stories, however when we arrived, we realised we had nothing to worry about. The hotel is in a very safe and convinient location within Barcelona, its not on a main road, so its very quiet. A short walk to many shops cafes and restraunts. We felt at ease walking around at night near the hotel. The staff here were very helpful with all of our requests. Our room was very spacious, including a huge bathroom and huge comfy king size bed. Our room did not include breakfast but there is a cute cafe next to the cathedral, about 50m from the hotel with a great breakfast. The rooftop pool was great, after walking around in the heat all morning it was so nice to relax and take a dip, but to get a sunbed or table, you have to get there by 3pm (this could have been because it was high season - August) The hotel also has a cute courtyard restraunt area to eat or have drinks, but I highly reccomend eating and drinking down near the port/beach area at sunset as there are heaps of gorgeous restraunts and bars right near the sand. If I was to come back to Barcelona I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean, but let down by a few small problemss”
Reviews.Author: Adstring
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a recent trip to Barcelona. I picked this hotel over some of the bigger chain hotels (Barcelo, Hisperia etc) even though it's in the same price range. In terms of location, it was perfect. Right by the main Cathedral (as you'd expect given the hotel's name) and in the centre of the old town. The hotel itself is very modern. It's very comfortable and was immaculately clean. The reception staff were very friendly and helped us with maps and suggestions. Unfortunately, the room was a little smaller than I would have liked - but it didn't really bother us. If you're someone who likes a very large spacious room then you might not have been so comfortable. The roof terrace was nice, but it wasn't possible to swim in the pool as it was freezing cold (in fact, so cold that 3 pigeons were drinking the water when we arrived!). I think the most frustrating issue was that the hotel charged for tea and coffee in the rooms. I stay in a lot of hotels (usually the big chains) for work and have never once been charged for making myself a cup of coffee in the room. In my opinion, this cheapens the hotel - why would you ask your guests who are paying 150 EUR a night to pay an additional 1.50 EUR for coffee in their room? All in all, a good hotel (that has the potential to be a fantastic hotel) but I hope the manager takes note of the little things that really do make a difference. Adam

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the 4 star we expected”
Reviews.Author: Dereham_NorfolkSue
Reviews.Content: Room was modern and clean, king size bed, average comfort, barthroom with constant hot water, and complmentary toiletries. Tea making facility provided, but no complimentary tea, coffee, milk or sugar, which was a bit of a let down on their side, however the hotel did provide a small comlimentary bottle of water, although not enough for two people. Mini bar extortionate prices. For a 4 star hotel I didn't expect to find the wardrobe door held together with masking tape. Breakfast was very good, with a menu choice, waitress was an asset to the Hotel. Dissapointed with reception staff on arrival, no offer to take luggage to the room, or give imformation on hotel facilities, meal times etc. A very good location near the Cathedral.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff and very comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: jonesjabat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Catedral Barcelona for 2 nights in late August. The hotel has a very modern yet also welcoming feel to it. We arrived an hour or so earlier than the check in time of 2pm but were quickly checked in and were allowed to our room straight away. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is second to none, right in the centre of lots of hustle and bustle, only a 5 minute walk to El Born, 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas and plently of shops, bars and restaurants right on your doorstep. Very close to Jaume 1 and Liceu metro stations also. The room was contemporary, and clean although once we had unpacked it did feel a little cramped but not the smallest we have stayed in. The bed was larger than usual and the pillows were very comfortable and to be honest we didn't want to get up in the morning they were that good! The rooftop pool is a very nice addition - very welcome after a hot day shopping and sightseeing. We didn't use the bar facilities or eat at the hotel so cannot comment. We would definitely stay here again and recommend to others because the location is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: keekeeM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel after disembarking our cruise ship in Barcelona. It was easy to get to via taxi from the port--about a 10-15 minute drive on a Sunday morning. The hotel was modern looking but comfortable and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. We checked in early but the room was not ready until 2pm so the hotel stored our bags while we went on a complimentary walking tour sponsored by the hotel. The walking tour was short, but very nice and pointed out a few things we would not have learned on our own. The hotel also offers free internet access and a complimentary drink in the bar. There is also a pool, however, we did not use it so I can't comment on it. This hotel is in a great location--right near the Cathedral, very near metro stops, and we could walk easily to most sights. We also walked to dinner from the hotel--it was very manageable. There was even a concert in the plaza next to the hotel that night. The only bad part was that we had to get up early to catch our flight and the concert went on until after midnight and could be heard rather loudly in the room, even with the windows closed and shades drawn. This seemed to bother my husband more than me, but wasn't a deal breaker for us. The room itself was rather large for a European hotel room and very comfortable. The bathroom was generously sized with amenities. We requested a taxi the next morning to get to the airport and it arrived promptly. The transport to the airport was approximately $40 euros and took about 20-30 minutes. We would definitely stay here again, it was very pleasant, good location and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city stay”
Reviews.Author: cathaz
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay, location was great, staff went overboard to help where they could, they even printed directions if you wanted somewhere to go. They also had 3 pcs with free internet access open 24/7 which was extremely helpful too. We did not eat there so i cannot comment on food. Room very clean and had everything we needed, only thing i could fault was there was no mirror over the dressing table area (where you would be doing your hair) the only other negative was there were not enough sun beds around the pool other than that excellent One prob we did have which is not the hotels fault was our last night was a very sleepless one as it was their 'festival of fire' which consisted of constant fireworks all night! So if you are going to barcelona and want sleep check when these festivals are

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Murlin100
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel mainly on price and were not disappointed. Very good location, close to many of the sights of Barcelona, and the hop on, hop off bus. Close to extrememly good shopping area - all the sales were on! My husband was there on business and I did shopped! Rooms comfortable, spacious and well appointed, bathroom of a good size. Plenty of places to eat surrounding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But First Impression Leaves A Sour Taste”
Reviews.Author: Foma
Reviews.Content: In any business, particularly the hospitality business, first impressions are important for first time visitors. If you don't present the customer with your best from the start, all other aspects of the service you provide will be clouded. But first let's talk about the positives. A perfect location for first-time visitors to Barcelona. Located across the street from Catedral de Barcelona and one block from La Rambla which will get you on your way to the port or Placa de Catalunya and L'Eixample. The hotel is clean and modern. There is a bar and lounge just off the front desk, a computer room and dining area. The top floor has a pool, though it is rather small (more like a lap pool) and cramped. The rooms are moderately sized with the usual amenities and fairly comfortable beds. The air conditioning, however was a problem. We had three rooms and really only one room had adequate a/c for the two days we stayed. The hallways were quite hot, so I am assuming there was no a/c out there. As with most hotels if you want to eat breakfast at the hotel it's going to be quite expensive. This was the same here. However, if you do take the breakfast, it is quite good with much to choose from and the wait staff were very attentive. Having said all that, now comes the problem area. I booked the hotel directly through the hotel after trading e-mails with the staff ironing out questions and requests that I had. There was 5 of us in our party: 2 adults and 3 minors. So we needed three rooms with two adjoining. The hotel said this would be no problem and we settled on that. I had also told them that we would be arriving early and that if it was possible to check-in earlier than the 2:00 pm check in that would be great, but if not we understood. So we arrived at the hotel and were told that the rooms weren't ready and come back at 2. We stored our bags and began our sight-seeing. When we returned to the hotel a little before 2, tired, hot and jet-lagged we were told our rooms wouldn't be ready for another 1/2 hour to an hour. We argued the point that check-in was at 2, but to no avail. They said that if we hadn't booked adjoining rooms we could check in now. The only solace we were given was that we could get a drink in the bar. 20 minutes later they came back and said one of the rooms was ready. So five people with five suitcases moved into one room. As it turns out, the rooms aren't adjoining, they are across the hall from each other at the end of a hallway. They then added two doors that can be shut so you can walk across the hall in privacy. However, these doors which use the card key to get in are so flimsy that even shut and locked you can still push them open without the key. We eventually got our rooms, but without any recompense or offer of any kind from the hotel. Despite these problems, it was overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: annievde
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, comfortable, parking not easy.Hotel situated close to Catedral

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: kenmags
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a seven night stay at the Barcelona Catedral Hotel in Barcelona. The purpose of our visit was to attend the European Athletics Championships held in the 1992 Olympic Stadium in Barcelona. The location on a quiet street just behind the main square of the Cathedral could not have been better and our first impression was a good one. The staff were welcoming, friendly and very helpful. We enjoyed a lovely breakfast each morning which had both cooked and continental options. Everything was freshly cooked to order and the fresh fruit selection was delicious. We were very impressed with the staff who were efficient, friendly and helpful. The room we had was very quite with a large double bed which was very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and had a great shower over the bath. The linen and towels were of the highest quality and the toiletries in the bathroom were replaced as a matter of course. The general areas along with the rest of the Hotel were spotlessly clean and very well maintained. This was our third visit to Barcelona and although the Athletics Championships were fantastic and it was made much more memorable by our stay at the fantastic Barcelona Catedral Hotel. Although we did not have much time to use the hotel facilities we did mange a little sunbathing beside the small swimming pool on the roof terrace.If you are thinking of going to Barcelona we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great, wheelchair accessible hotel at the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Wil-Jam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 11 nights in July 2010. After reading the reviews from TripAdvisor the expectations were high. Barcelona Catedral met them all. My girlfriend uses a wheelchair and we contacted the hotel in advance to get an accessible room. Already at this point the service was excellent, for example we got pictures of the room in advance to see the facilities etc. The room was very stylish and comfortable. We had windows towards the courtyard and the room was extremely quiet. The bed was firm, but comfortable. The common areas and lobby were very clean. The pool area on the roof was small, but very nice and usually there was always room. They even had a wheelchair elevator on the roof to the poolside. Next to the pool was a small gym with treadmill, crosstrainer excersise bike and a set of dumbbells up to 10kg. I could have used heavier weights, but everything else was ok. We had the breakfast included and it was totally worth it. We enjoyed it a lot. The lunch restaurant was also very good. We had lunch once there and for 18 euros we got a three course menu that was one of the best that we had on the whole trip. There was usually some local business people eating at the restaurant. The location is absolutely perfect. Right in the middle of everything and still on a quiet side street. Right from the hotel started huge shopping areas that continued for many kms. The catedral next to the hotel was probably the most impressive church there (La Sagrada Familia excluded). We mostly walked everywhere, but the subway connections were excellent. We would,will and have recommended the hotel to anyone. The room was excellent, location perfect and the staff friendly. Most of the staff also spoke English very well. The price of the hotel is very affordable compared to what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet rooms, good quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: sjburme
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel. We requested to be on a top floor in a quiet room, since we read some reviews online that stated the street noise was very loud. The pool was great. The large TV was great. We could control the a/c ourselves. The only downfall was that we requested to change rooms the first night. The first room we were given had a broken thermostat, so the a/c never got cool enough. The safe didn't work either. The front desk was very accommodating and changed our room right away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in the Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jamessoncuya
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations, it was beautifully decorated, rooms very modern and clean and staff was awesome. The location was unbeatable, 5 mins to las ramblas, steps fom the magnificent cathedral and a few minutes to the major shopping avenue. You get both worlds here, a short walk to all the attractions but in a quite location away from the hustle and bustle. The plaza right outside the hotel is very nice with a few restaurants which was nice for a night cap after a busy day touring the magnificent city. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: laneyManchester
Reviews.Content: Fantastic CHIC Hotel, Tucked away in a superb location of the GOTHIC QUARTER. Step out of the hotel to the magnificent sight of the Cathedral and just minutes away from LAS RAMBLAS. If you want a memorable holiday experience then be sure to choose this hotel. The staff are all multilingual, friendly, polite and professional,. Pool area is small but suffiecient. Breakfast was served to a high standard and a free tour around the ohic area is not to be missed! Chill out area, with loungers and exotic plants is cosmopolitan and looks truly relaxing but closed at 11pm Overall we would definately recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Renatabaltimore
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights in Barcelona. We booked for the room with breakfast which was an excellent choice as the breakfast was outstanding. We were able to walk to many of the locations and easily found the hop on and off bus which was quite close. The front desk was friendly and most helpful. We would certainly return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,”
Reviews.Author: sgrabski
Reviews.Content: There were three couples staying overnight before our cruise. We had very comfortable rooms. Quiet but not too far from the Ramblas. The hotel was a great location as we were able to walk to metro/ one couple used the hop on/off bus just to tour Barcelona. We all went to lunch at a tapas bar recommended by the hotel staff which was close by and very good. Also had a Starbucks within walking distance for morning coffee. We all walked the Ramblas and just headed off and found a wonderful resturant for dinner. It was La Dentelliere 26 Ample. The next day before our cruise we went out and did some more walking around Barcelona. Sorry to say we felt we didn't get to spend enough time there. Although two couples did go to the Sagrada Familia which was spectacular to see in person!!! If you're looking for a reasonable place to stay close to Ramblas I would say this was a very good choice for a 4 star hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent mid-range hotel, close to everything with many extras”
Reviews.Author: RuthAnne11
Reviews.Content: Hotel review:Fabulous, modern, and spacious! We loved the quiet, central location with breakfast included and free bikes and free internet! Great, friendly service. We stayed for 8 nights on our honeymoon and loved every second. It's a little pricey for the simple accomodations unless you get breakfast included in your package. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, excellent position”
Reviews.Author: catlady11
Reviews.Content: A real gem. This new, modern hotel is tucked away in the Barri Gothic district of Barcelona. Most of the tourist attractions are within walking distance. The hotel was clean the room spacious and the bathroom modern and very user friendly, no high bath sides and leaky shower curtains. There is a pool on the roof as well as a gym. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Barcelona made more interesting by the night walk which is provided for free to hotel guests !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: katjohns55
Reviews.Content: 7 of us stayed at the Hotel Catedral for 3 nights and were very pleased. The location is wonderful as it is in the plaza with the beautiful Cathedral along with several restaurants, cafes, currency exchange, pharmacy, etc. The taxis cannot drop you in front of the hotel as it is on a small side street but ours dropped us in the plaza and we just walked a few yards. Do make sure to tell the taxi to drop you in the Catedral plaza. Our friends dropped them about 2 blocks away and that's difficult with lots of luggage.The staff was very accommodating and spoke English well. They ordered us a van service to take us to the airport for our day of departure and it was on time. We did not eat the breakfast for 18.50 Euro per person but there are cafes closeby and one day we went to the large Market on the Las Rambla and picked up fruit, bread and cheese to have in the room. There is a coffee/tea maker in the room but you get charged for using it. We were only a couple blocks from the Las Rambla, Plaza Catalunya, metro, shopping, and about a 5 minute cab ride to the Mediterranean Sea. Some great restaurants along there (one being Aqua). The rooms were modern and roomy for Europe with a nice size bathroom. Being on the sidestreet away from the main roads was great as it was very quiet. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet hidden gem conveniently located!”
Reviews.Author: Kellysan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barcelona Catedral for 3 nights. We took the Aerobus from Barcelona Airport 5 euros each way. The Aerobus was easy to find at the airport and they dropped us off at Placa Catalunya. From there it was a short 5-7 minute walk to the hotel. There are cabs at the Placa Catalunya in case you don't want to walk to the hotel from the bus stop. Once we arrived at the hotel we were warmly greeted by the hotel staff who checked us in very quickly. The staff was very accomodating when I told them I did not want a room near the elevator. They had 2 other rooms available for me to look at and I chose the more quiet room facing the Vietnamese Restaurant. The room waspacious and came with a king size bed. The bed was firm, but the sheets were soft and comfortable. The a/c worked great. The bathroom had plenty of room and came with a nice big bathtub and a shower. Housekeeping did an excellent job of cleaning our room. The Buffe Breakfast consisted of pastry's, desserts, fruit salad, yogurt and cereal. We enjoyed our stay at the Barcelona Cathedral and felt like it was a hidden gem conveniently located near the Las Rambla and the Metro Stop at Placa Catalunya (<5 min walk). We would definitely stay hear again! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “superb location and spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: keentraveller76
Reviews.Content: My partner and I staid 5 nights, combing business and leasure. The hotel has a superb location in the Gotic Quarter, on the edge of the cathedral square, being close to a lot of points of interest (within walking distance). The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean, with all facilities one might expect from a 4 star hotel. The internet access worked properly, but wasn't free of charge. The hotel is the proud owner of what seems to be a nice restaurant, where breakfast is served as well. However, we didn't opt for breakfast, as it came at the rate of €18,5 pp, which we deamed far too high. With so many options within 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel (both local cafés and shops and 2 international Starbucks stores) this can't be seen as a logistical problem. Staff were very helpful and friendly (for instance when arranging a taxi or printing a document). Although maybe a bit well priced, this hotel can be highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: graduation15
Reviews.Content: We spent a glorious week with friends,location could not be better, close to everythings, museum, markets, shops,restaurants .Bedrooms and bathrooms with everything you could need ,very clean, friendly staff.We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Reiskew
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for exploring the old city (Barri Gotic, La Rambla, Born, and Raval) as well as the eastern reaches of the Eixample area. It is a short walk to Placa Catalunya where the hop-on-hop off buses originate (recommend the red route - its the only one we took). The location also felt safe - my husband went back to the hotel early while I spent a bit more time in the shops and I walked back after dark with no concerns. The staff were friendly and were very proficient in English. The room was small by North American standards but very comfortable (good firm bed) and with a large bathroom. The decor is neutral and modern, the windows open, and there is a nice selection of amenities provided in the bathroom. We had an inside room on the 1st floor (one above ground) and found it to be quiet although we did have to call the front desk about what seemed like a very loud TV coming from down the hall. This was dealt with promptly. After long days of walking around we were happy to return to the room for some relaxation and took advantage of the in-room media package. For 19 euros we had access to all media for 24 hours, including unlimited movies in that time, a selection of music, and internet access through the TV. Given that one movie alone was 15 euro this was a good option. There is a pharmacy located around the corner from the hotel for any forgotten necessities. We had a drink at the hotel restaurant but did not eat there so can't comment on it. Given the number of restaurants in the immediate area we did not take the hotel breakfast which seemed expensive at about 18 euro pp. There is a coffee maker in the room but there is a charge of 1.50 to use the provided coffee packets. The small roof top pool and patio would be nice in fair weather but it was too cold for us to use. We got a good rate booking through Otel.com.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: beadladySeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this comfortable and conveniently located hotel in the heart of the Gothic Quarter. We chose this hotel based solely on the reviews we read on tripadvisor. com. We were not disappointed. Just steps from the quiet side street the hotel is located on is the Catedral. From there you can walk or take the metro or bus to just about any point of interest in the city. The service is good, rooms are cleaned daily with refreshing of towels, etc. There is no noise outside the hotel at night that would prevent sleeping well. The desk personnel are courteous and helpful. We did not take advantage of the guided night walk on the Wednesday of our stay because of the heavy rains that evening. We are sorry to have missed that. I would definitely recommend this hotel for location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Marigold79
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! We were right next to the roof top pool. Fantastic location - shopping so close by. Rooms very clean and modern. The staff could use a "customer service" course...often not helpful and unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting boutique hotel in a superb position”
Reviews.Author: aeb67
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the end of January 2010 on the way down to Nerja in the South. We cannot fault this hotel for a short break with sightseeing in mind. On the Wednesday evening there was a free guided walk of the Gothic quarter which was most interesting and we were taken down small alleys which we would not have ventured down by ourselves. There is a wonderful tapas bar by the hotel called Bilbao and we were in easy walking distance of Las Ramblas and plenty of shops. We took the hop on hop off tourist bus around the city which was a good way to familiarize ourselves with the main sights. We also had a lovely lunch down by the port sitting outside in the sunshine. The hotel reception were very helpful, the breakfast was excellent and the room was quiet at night. Taxi was able to collect us at the front door of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Topendtraveller
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6 adults (40 - 55 years) stayed 1 night pre-cruise and 2 nights post-cruise. The hotel is in a great location just a few steps from the Barcelona Cathedral, resturants, banks and shops and about 10 minutes walk from the Ramblas. The hotel is in a minamilist, modern style with good sized rooms and bathrooms including flat screen TV , room safe, coffee/tea making facilities and internet access (around 10 euro for 24 hours access) There are also free computers/internet services in the lobby area. The hotel stay also included a free walking tour on Sunday with an english speaking guide that was excellent. The desk staff were very helpful and assisted us with early/late check-in/check out and provided luggage storage and advice on what to see and do during our brief stay. An excellent hotel that lived up to our expectations and added to our overall experience in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Thanks TripAdvisor!”
Reviews.Author: NaevusIreland
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner visited Barcelona in February 2010 and decided to stay in Hotel Catedral on the basis of the reviews we'd read on this site. We were not disappointed. The hotel is located minutes from the Ramblas and is perfectly positioned for exploring the warren of streets that makes up Barcelona's old town. Check-in was quick and efficient and there was no problem with us getting access to our room despite arriving at 11am. The room itself was on the small side but perfectly adequate and everything one would expect from a four star hotel. One minor quibble was that we had requested a double bed in advance but got two single beds pushed together. In our experience this is not uncommon in Spain so it wasn't a major hindrance. We had no problems with noise despite our room overlooking the street.As others have noted, you should bring your own tea/coffee as you will be charged for using the tea/coffee provided by the hotel in your room. The gym/pool area is on the roof and quite small and though we didn't use these facilities, they looked modern to us. We thought the breakfast provided was superb and as good as most 5 star hotels we have stayed in. All the food is fresh and of high quality and the service was top notch. The tray of breads and pastries laid out on each table is a lovely touch. All in all we would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely return to it should we visit Barcelona again. Which is very likely as it is a really fabulous city!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Calm in Busy Plaza"”
Reviews.Author: Ellens25
Reviews.Content: I spent hours on Trip Advisor looking for a Barcelona hotel at no more than $200 a night including breakfast that didn't have a lot of negative points such as: too noisy, luggage stolen from lobby, tiny room, uncomfortable bed, bad service, or all of the above. Hotel Barcelona Catedral did not disappoint: we got a not-exactly-spacious, but immaculately modernist room with soundproofed windows and very comfortable bed, extremely helpful service, and excellent full breakfasts in the hotel restaurant with an urbane Euro crowd. I practiced my Spanish/Catalan, but everyone spoke perfect English. It was January so we were not able to take advantage of the lovely patio and rooftop pool area. I don't think I would stay in the Ciutat Vella area again, though, I'd prefer to be off the Passaig de Gracia. Nevertheless, the Catedral is in easy walking distance of just about everything. One negative: no free wi-fi, which I think every decent hotel on the planet should offer... especially to us iPhone users. And it would be nice to have free water and coffee in the room, not at outrageous mini-bar prices.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenstar333
