Reviews.Content: this hotel was perfect for us, it was centrally located and the rooms modern and clean. staff were friendly and helpful. as many others have said the internet in the rooms and tea bags you had to pay for which is a bit of a bummer but there is free internet in the lobby. never had breakfast in the hotel, it seemed too expensive and the mercat santa caterina (local produce market) is just around the corner for a cheap and tasty local breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Triz
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. This hotel really is in the old town and right next to the cathedral. Its location allows you to walk to Rambus( a very busy pedestrian area) . The hotel is directly off a main shopping street. It is only a three minute walk to pick up the hop on hop off bus for sightseeing. The buses are also a great way to cover alot of the city in a short time. The hotel room was very clean and there was plenty of room for suitcases etc.. It was quite warm in the room and the window only opens a little bit. There is no option for air conditioning as it is winter but as soon as I called the front desk and inquired if the window could be opened further they sent a fan right up tot he room. The beds are a bit hard but certainly comfortable enough to get a good nights sleep. The pillows were perfect. There is a nice set up for coffee and tea in the room but beware you will be charged for it. The check in was fast and they were always friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions. I booked the hotel through a package with British air so not sure about exact cost..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service”
Reviews.Author: BeeHYW
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Catedral for three nights in mid of September. The location was excellent, pretty much walking distance to main areas for shopping or food. The rooms are spacious and clean, and very modern. Staff is excellent. The only minus is that the computers at teh lobby did not work properly... Would recommend for the great values!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: HaifaTraveler33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a long weekend and we recommend it whole heartedly. The hotel exceeded our expectations. First of all the location cannot be bested. In all other respects the hotel was very good; clean, comfortable, and with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aaaabbbbsss
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern hotel, close to all attractions and central, plenty of reatsurants/bars near by, trying Schillings bar not far. Spacious bathroom and nice big bed if you get a king size. Breakfast was very nice but is 19 euros per person so book the room with breakfast inc. if you can. Roof top pool very nice but cold. Reception very nice, spoke perfect english & very helpful with directions and subway information. Was 30 euro from airport to hotel, would definately recommend getting the aero bus or subway. Overall a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will use the same hotel next time!”
Reviews.Author: TommyHavardstun
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! Be sure to get a price included breafast. They had one of the best breakfast I ever had in a hotel. :-) Location next to Barcelona Catedral, close to everything. Just one negative thing; the beds were to hard....

Reviews.Title: “Superb Ultra Modern Hotel in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: bonniemreeves
Reviews.Content: This hotel just opened in the center of the Barro Gothic. It is very chic and very modern--a real boutique hotel. Excellent service and lovely breakfast available in the dining room. Ultra modern rooms with lovely decor. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, helpful staff in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: joycejac
Reviews.Content: my son and I arrived at the end of "la Merce"...our room was not ready for about 2 hours, but the staff gave us a glass of cava "on the house" and after our long journey, it was much appreciated! Thank you for making our first trip to this fabulous city, a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “A Small Gem”
Reviews.Author: LONGISLAND001
Reviews.Content: Just Great. Ideal location right around the corner from the Cathedral and a couple blocka from the Rambla. Clean,neat and spacious room with attentive staff. Included breakfast was a wonderful way to fuel up for our rambles through this interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have ever been”
Reviews.Author: NoraIsrael
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect! the faclities and decoration of the rooms are excelent! But above all is the personal and excelent service: the courtesy on every ocasion! Breakfast wa excelent! very recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Standard”
Reviews.Author: SteelerFanUS
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. I was supposed to have king bed but the room had no air conditioning. I had to complain several times until he finally came to the room (over an hour and we were to meet others in our group) and then he argued there was air moving...yes the fan was blowing but it was blowing warm air. I finally convinced his to change our room. I had to move suit cases myself, only gave me one key so no air until we were in room (38 C outside) and provided no comp even though our new room was significantly smaller and only had two single beds. Will never stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find! Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tollyindy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my 18 year old son. We have stayed in Barcelona many times visiting friends and have been lucky enough to find some really lovely hotels, this one is up with them all! Friendly staff, great location, rooms clean and fresh and the great added bonus of the lovely pool on the roof! Great alue for money, I hope it stays that way. If you want something that ticks all the boxes, this the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “great position,”
Reviews.Author: tomotours
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Catedral mid September.We arrived early a were able to check in.Very welcoming front desk and helpfull.Hotel is in a great position and close to Front, Ramblas,Placa Real and other sights.Rooms are clean and modern as is the rest of the hotel.One night the rain was heavy and we were able to borrow umberellas and also a nice touch are bicycles that can be used free of charge. Only down side was the charge for sachets of tea and coffee in the room. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel: great location, great boutique style, great service”
Reviews.Author: ek34
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the city. Close to everything. Great boutique style. The Spanish (the Catalonians) have a great sense of style and beauty and it is really captured well is this hotel. Very sexy, Christina Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: MARCO J
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Barcelona and when you go to a city, one aspect that can make your stay perfect perfect is the hotel. This was one of this cases. The staff at the Barcelona Catedral is friendly, always looking to be of help, the breakfast has a great choice and well, the restaurant at night is a blast! Also the rooms are modern, clean and highly comfortable. When things are bad one has to say, when things are great, one has also to say!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: E_S_Liam
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Bacelona Catedral for 4 nights with our 2 year old son. I had high hopes for this hotel since it was rated #18 on tripadvisor. I have to say I was a little dissapointed. This hotel is four stars but I would say it's closer to three stars. When we arrived (with a young child), we were automatically given a smoking room, we were never asked for our preference. In today's world, a hotel should not presume (and I believe few do) that a person would prefer a smoking room unless otherwise specified. We went right back to reception and asked for a non-smoking room. We were told that the hotel was very full but they would get us a non smoking room. Now, you either have the non smoking room or not. Why the lame excuse? We got to our room and it was really hot inside. The air does not come on unless you are actually IN the room and have the key place inside the holder adjacent to the entrance! It took a few hours to cool the room down but even then, the AC was not very powerful at all. In addition, the hotel is so cheap, as soon as the sun goes down, they turn off the AC in the lobby and general hotel areas. When you arrive back from dinner to your hotel, be prepared to be just as hot inside as it was outside. A couple of more odd things. The room did not come with a "do not disturb" sign. We called the front desk and a security guard (?) brought us a sign. The following morning we left the room as kept the do not distrub sign up as we did not want housekeeping to come into our room. They came in anyway and they removed the extra key from the slot that powers the room so we once again arrived in a hot room and waited a few hours for it to cool down. We advised the front desk of this and hoped for better the following day but yet again, same scenario. The final blow was the day we checked out. We packed up our stuff walked to the elevator and waited, and waited for the elevator to come. Mind you, it was early and the AC was not really running in the hallways yet and we just stood there sweating. My husband finally walked down the stairs to see what was going on. We were advised that the elevator was broken. I understand that this happens, but a sign advising guest of this and a little help down the stairs with your bags would have been nice. Now, what I did like about the hotel was the location. It is centrally located yet it is very quiet. Since we traveled with our toddler, it was also nice to have a hot water boiler in the room. The rooms were clean and the staff were pleasant enough. If this hotel was selling rooms for 80 Euro's a night, I may have been able to deal with these mishaps, but when I'm paying 130 Euro's a night, I expect more.

Reviews.Title: “unaccomadating”
Reviews.Author: FabF0urTravelers
Reviews.Content: We really wanted to stay at this hotel because of the great reviews. We couldn't get a room on our own but a major credit card's company travel agency booked it for us. We got there and the hotel's look met my expectations. We try to check in with our four year old and baby. We are told that we can't stay there b/c we didn't book our children (the travel agency had told us that we did). Then, we were told that we could stay there for an extra $75 a night (eventually the credit card company negotiated it down to $35). At this point, it was an hour after we arrived. I went around the corner and found a charming hotel (Hotel Colon) who said not a problem with our children. We would have stayed there our entire visit, but we wanted a pool for our son. So, we moved to Grand Hotel Central (not as good reviews on tripadvisor which I don't understand because they were incredibly accomodating, less expensive for the same amentities).

Reviews.Title: “Smart and modern hotel. Located in the Gothic District.”
Reviews.Author: VegasBuff
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is modern, clean, and hip. My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a few nights during June of 2009. The rooms were refreshingly large, roomy, and clean. The pool on the roof top was pretty sizable compared to other hotels in Barcelona. The lobby was cool and retro and there were plenty of working computer terminals available to check email and browse the web. Alex at the front desk was extemely helpful with finding a great place to eat. The location of this hotel is both great and horrible at the same time. The location is great because it is located right in the heart of the gothic district which means you can easily walk to great restaurants like The Four Cats, and Caracoles, and great museums like the Picasso museum. However, the hotel location is bad for two reasons. It is very difficult to find even for the taxi drivers for one. And second, the Gothic district is the pick-pocketers headquarters so you must be on alert as soon as you leave the property which is very tiring. Be sure to wear your backpack on your front and carry as little of value as possible while exploring the Gothic district. It is full of punks who work in groups to pickpocket travelers. The use their cell phones and are very coordinated. Be very careful! I mean it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but internet is not 100 percent free as their web site claims”
Reviews.Author: hmotulsky
Reviews.Content: Three computers in the lobby are free. Fast connection, nice computers, but mostly busy. wifi costs 15 euros a day. The hotel is great otherwise. Nice location, nice rooms, nice pool but cold.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel - nothing too much trouble!”
Reviews.Author: dmackay41
Reviews.Content: When I return to Barcelona, I will make a point of staying at this hotel. Lovely and clean with efficient and extremely polite staff. As I said in the title, nothing was too much trouble - free map, calling a taxi, late check-out, lunch reservation - brilliant! Rooms were clean, cool and spacious. Most importantly, they were extremely quiet which was unusual for Barcelona! All in all an excellent stay and i would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Ten out of Ten!”
Reviews.Author: Thebairds
Reviews.Content: Booked this for daughters birthday so this is her review!! Trip with friends to celebrate my 21st birthday. Hotel was chosen after family had trawled through reviews on the net. Perfect choice! E-mailed hotel to request rooms near each other if possible and this was promised...and delivered! Many thanks. Reception staff were really friendly whilst checking in and always helpful if and when we required any advice. Hotel was modern, spotlessly clean and a pleasure to stay in. Rooms were spacious and the housekeeping was excellent....fresh towels and linen daily and rooms always immaculate when we returned from a busy day. Can't comment on all facilities but we did make good use of the lovely rooftop pool which was a fabulous way to relax after shopping all day! Could go on and on but basically you can't go wrong here! The location is fabulous, the hotel is lovely but most importantly we felt that we were most welcome and that the impression we left with was very important to all staff. In a city so busy with tourists it is easy for hotels to take their trade for granted. Not here! Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Parfait ! Perfect ! Perfecto !”
Reviews.Author: StefaneNantes
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a 3night stay in Barcelona Catedral Hotel. Everything was perfect from the first to the last minute. Welcome is smiling, rooms are clean, big and modern, breakfast is just amazing, roof pool is so good after a full walking day (!) and the advices we got from the desk officer for good and typical restaurants were just perfect. Looking forward to coming again ! Merci à toute l'équipe de l'hotel pour ce beau séjour. Muchas gracias a todos para este perfecto momento ! Thanks to all for such a welcome !

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: RickandMary
Reviews.Content: Location was superb. The service excellent and overall good value. We will come back to Barcelona and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Julie_Nef
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 3 night stay at catedral. Breakfast was on a terrace outside, not a buffet as expected, but dangerously lovely pastries already on your table, and a free choice of cooked breakfast or continental hams cheese etc. The rooftop pool was a must in the plus 30 degree city heat! Prob could do with more beds? Was bit cramped one day. Air con in our room was not so great but we did not ask for help so perhaps was our fault. Huge beds, only a little hard. In a brilliant position right smack bang in the middle of the gothic (original roman settlement) part of the city. Bursting with character, bars, resturants, shops, etc. Would definitely recomend this hotel and I am hard to please. 5 mins walk to las Ramblas but much much nicer in the streets around the cathederal.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place To Stay In Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: wclegends
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful one week vacation in Barcelona. The Hotel Barcelona Catedral was the perfect place to stay. It is located on a side street, 1/2 block from the Catedral's very large plaza, which always has something of interest going on. The room was very large, filled with conveniences, a beautiful large bathroom, with a swimming pool and fitness gym on the 5th floor roof and free internet computers on the ground floor. The front desk staff was over the top cooperative and helpful. You couldn't ask for more from a hotel, except maybe to have a tapas bar in your room. But then there are two very friendly tapas bars in the plaza. Also, the hotel is very convenient for the easy to use Barcelona metro, taxi cabs, and the city tour buses.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable. Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: shawana80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights after our cruise. We got there a bit early they were nice enough to keep our luggage, and let us join their free walking tour (which was lovely). The rooms were modern, clean, and comfortable. 2 things I didn't like: 1) 20 Euros charge for TV 2) the shower door is really illogically placed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Tour_de_Spain
Reviews.Content: This was the final stop of an 11 day tour of spain with my husband and another couple. By far this was the nicest most modern property that we stayed at during our trip. The rooms are very nice, although it had the smallest rooms of all of the hotels but it was not uncomfortable. Our room faced the interior courtyard so it was very quiet although the hotel is located on a very small street without much traffic so I can't imagine that the rooms facing the street are noisy. The front desk staff was very nice and accommodating, expecially Alex. The location is great, walking distance to Las Ramblas, the waterfront and many Gaudi buildings. There are 3 Metro stops within in 2-3 blocks. The rooftop pool was great and relaxing, not very large but it was never overly crowded. The room does not have a dresser for clothing but a nice sized closet in the room. No iron in the room but available if you ask, there is a hair dryer in the bathroom and the bathroom was very nice, modern and clean. I can't say enough good things about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Sheila44561
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Gotic area of Barcelona. We walked out of the hotel and were able to walk in a beautiful square. Lots of cafes and of course the Cathedral. Good to note is that there is a Starbucks right there! Room has a nice shower - great for after a long flight. Taxi to the hotel from the airport was around $20 Euros and took about 20 minutes. The A/C and the lights do not work unless you have the room key in the slot to turn the power on - typical for Europe, but good to note.

Reviews.Title: “Best option in Barcelona city”
Reviews.Author: IOS-IOS
Reviews.Content: We satayed at Barcelona Catedral last April . We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel . The Hotel is new , clean and confortable . It´s located at the city center , old city . It´s very quiet, just 1 minute walking to the cathedral . Our room was big, clean and quiet . We loved the chill out area just to rest afther our walks in the old city. The hotel has a lovely terrace with a gymn and a superb outside pool . Wonderful views from the terrace , we had breakfast there every day ... All the staff was nice and professional, specially Front desk. We enjoyed Barcelona , and we enjoyed Barcelona Cathedral Hotel , we hope to stay there next time visiting this amazing city . Hazvrosky Family .

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION, FASHION TERRACE & SWIMINGPOOL ON THE ROOF”
Reviews.Author: MarineraBruxelles
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull hotel, calm, relaxing ambience so trendy! The terrace is one of the best gifts ever! friendly and familiar staff, ask them for advice, information! Best location ever, in the center, just near the gotic fantastic to mixt with the authentic Barcelonean ambience !

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel to visit the real Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: analema
Reviews.Content: In the middle of the historic Barcelona. Perfect transport comunications. 30 minutes to airport. Excellent service, and very very nice swiming pool !!!!! Be quiet in the center of this magnific city .

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: renovatio
Reviews.Content: one of the most centrally located hotels in barcelona.the rooms a large an lavish, the pool is located on the top floor of the hotel though its not very large but perfect to unwind after an evenfull day.its located in the center of all the action 5 mins walking dist from the la ramblas but yet away from all the noise and hub run. one of the most amazing places is the jewish colony which is just behind the hotel an the hotel organises a free tour every sunday for all guests. the jewish colony bears the scares of the nazi invasion on world war 2 and has a lot of heritage to it. a 5-7 min walk and your on the la rambla where all the action of barcelona is. the hotel is very well connected with public transportation system. within a max 10 min walk there is access to public transport, starbucks, hard rock cafe,the rambla, a huge variety of banks. all in all a place i would always stay in when i am in barca.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LadyLaLaIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location in Barcelona. Only problem i had was that it said free internet access yet we were charged extra to use it. I dont mind having to pay but dont state that it is free if you are going to be charged.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Minxonholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in February and it was our first trip to Barcelona. The hotel was situated in a fantastic location in the old city, almost right opposite the Gothic Cathedral and within a 5 to 10 minute walk to La Ramblas or the Harbourfront. The rooms were soundproofed and it was generally very quiet for a hotel considering its location. The service at the front desk was always helpful and smiley, one member of staff in particular seemed to be able to switch from fluent spanish, to english to french all in a matter of seconds! The room itself was spacious, the bed seemed to be exceptionally firm which took a bit of getting used to! I'm not sure it needed to be quite as solid as that! It had a kettle and cups which was important to me, although you have to pay to use their teabags or coffee. So we knew this in advance and brought our own (I tend to drink other types of tea anyway). It's got a modern slick feel to the hotel and there were a couple of things which were not finished very well in the room, one of the cupboard doors didn't open fully because it stuck on the floor and in the bathroom the shower door wasn't flush on the edge so we had to make sure the door was inside the shower else the water went all over the floor! The shower was great though, nice and powerful. I had a bath one night and it filled up very quickly. The lights by the bedside were touch and you could alter their strength which was handy. We didn't eat at the restaurant, they offered a breakfast buffet for 18euro but we decided to find other alternative options (some great thick hot chocolates and churros!) They were a bit outside or our price bracket. They had a nice outside seating area where you can enjoy a drink though, although we never really saw anybody doing that. They do have a lovely pool upstairs with a tiny gym, it had a nice feel to the pool and is a decent size, it was too cold for us to make use of it though. I noticed after using a cremer in the room that the maid didn't replace it, so I used the other one and she didn't replace that either, not sure if that was because we hadn't paid for the tea packets? Seemed a bit strange to me. They do have Wifi although we didn't bring a laptop so there are the option of the three computers in the lobby which were really useful if you want to check location or opening or timetables! It's not as close to the Gaudi stuff although if you take their metro its really efficient and quick. We walked and it was a great way to see more of the city. There tend to be queues to get into the gaudi houses so its best to try and plan for less busier times of the day if you want to see inside La Pedera and Casa Batila(think thats the name), although La Sagrada Familia is easier to get into there is a queue to go right up and that is well worth the hour wait and extra 2.50Euros each! The room had a mini bar and a safe, we didn't use the safe and the mini bar wasn't included so it was (as most are) pretty pricey. If and when we do revisit Barcelona (we want to see La Sagarad completed!) then hopefully we will use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AmandaCambridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when it had just opened in 2006 and it was fantastic. The location, right in the centre of the town is perfect for sight-seeing and enabled us to get around and see everything we wanted to see with ease. The rooms were amazing - especially the lights which you touched the lampshade to turn on and off and the bathrooms were stunning. The whole hotel was kept immaculately clean and the staff were always helpful and cheerful. When we stayed they were only able to offer breakfasts as they had only just opened, but they were fantastic, with a good choice of foods on offer. I would definitely recommend this hotel and it would be the only hotel i considered if i returned to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, great location, would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: CFLDI
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at this hotel in february and thought it was excellent value for money, with lovely rooms, free internet access and situated in the heart of the city. Service was unobtrusive but good, staff were competent and friendly. There are lots of nice hotels in Barcelona but this is the nicest I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: moss87
Reviews.Content: I would definatley recommend this hotel, its in the perfect position, and is also nice and quiet of a night time. Really friendly staff who helped us with anything we needed to know. There's a nice tapas bar just as you come out of the hotel too which is definately worth a visit - Bilboa - something along those lines, can't remember the exact name. They also supplied us with a free tour of the gothic area of a Sunday morning which was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Four Stars”
Reviews.Author: JustRuss
Reviews.Content: Location alone is a great reason to stay at this hotel. Walk a few metres from the front door and you're standing in front of the Catedral. The friendly staff welcomed us at arrival and had prepared everything in advance of check-in so there were no delays. Service was very, very good. The hotel restaurant is open only for breakfast and lunch. As there are so many fine restaurants in the area, we never visited. Wireless internet is free, but be careful of the TV as it fairly aggressively attempts to steer you to pay channels. There is a pool and terrace, but we did not consider the amenities to be useful in January. The mattress was too firm, but the beds were nontheless comfortable. The room was quiet and clean with a few minor exceptions. This is another hotel I researched here at TA and wonder why it isn't rated more highly. Perhaps it is the price, however TA appears to quote only the in-season rate. I found this hotel to be quite reasonably priced and a very good value considering its location. There are other hotels on the plaza that appear to be in need of upgrading as opposed to this modernly decorated inn.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Golfbuggly
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its postion which is in the centre of the Gothic Quarter. It is just a few yards up a side street from the bustling square but our room, which overlooked the courtyard, was very quiet. There was some music from the courtyard on two nights but this stopped promptly before midnight. We didn't hear any city noise at all. The room was well equipped and well designed and the bathroom was spacious. The staff were very helpful indeed and the breakfast was excellent. I would recommend this hotel highly; even though we are older travellers, we were able to walk comfortably to many of the places we wanted to visit and felt very safe going out to dinner late and returning even later!! We really enjoyed our four day visit and would consider returning to Barcelona and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the cheapest but very good quality and supreme location.”
Reviews.Author: Rud-gr
Reviews.Content: Wow, talking about a hotel in the heart of this amazing city. The location is absolutely fabulous, hard to find a better one than this. The design and rooms are of very high standard and comfort, great bathrooms, good beds, all facilities are simply as you expect them to be in a 4 star hotel or better. Including free use of internet (fast) in your room or communal area. Staff is very friendly, speaks decent to good English and is very helpful. Spend some time to enjoy the breakfast (I highly reccommend the Catalionian). It's not the cheapest hotel around (off season double room would set you backaround €160 per night) but it's money well spent and very good value considering the quality of the whole package (they have a great pool too!). Only downside to this hotel is that you will find it hard to enjoy it fully as you will probably spend most of the time in the city, there's just too much to see and do! R. Geerling Professional travel writer/photographer (Netherlands)

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here best hotel ever......!”
Reviews.Author: CatHampshire
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, the decor is modern and simple yet really comfortable. Our room was amazing spacious and very clean. The bathroom was the highlight good hair dryer and power shower. I have stayed in so many hotels on business and this has been my best ever stay in a city centre hotel. You can not hear anything in the hotel the soundproofing must be good as our room was right by the lift and I never heard it or any other guests and I am light sleeper. It is down a side street so away from the hustle and bustle and nice and quite. Coming back in the afternoon it felt like an oasis of calm. We had breakfast which is huge - you can everything including bacon and eggs, toast, fruit ,ceeral and a wondeful selections of bread and pastries. The fresh fruit and freshly squeezed orange juice were a nice touch in the heat. You are very near everything and can walk everywhere. The buses are easy to get to from Placa Catalunya if your feet fancy a break and the airport bus stops here, it only cost 4.05 euro single to get to the airport and 1/2 an hour couldn't be easier. The hotel is a 5 minute walk away. Lastly the staff were amazing so friendly and helpful they could not do enough for us.....I would recommed this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “excellent located hotel”
Reviews.Author: huppeldepup_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week. We would recommend it to everyone. It is perfectly located close to the Cathedral in the gothic area with everything at walking distance (ramblas, port, shopping, El Born, metro...). The rooms are nice, clean and bright. Towels and sheets were changed every day. The hotel staff was very helpful and speaks English very well. The swimmingpool is a plus in summer time, unfortunately it was not heated during our stay in October, but very comfortable to enjoy the afternoon sun. Breakfast was freshly served at our table. They serve extra's like toast and eggs on simple request. I hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Crooks
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and picked it for the location, being in the old town and not being disturbed by traffic. The roof top pool was not heated or cleaned so was unusable except for a paddle, the sunbeds came in useful to catch late afternoon sunshine. The room we had overlooked the inner courtyard where there are chairs and sofas and piped music until late at night, so might upset some early to bed people. The best rooms were overlooking the quiet street. Avoid room 203 which is next to the office and is used from 8am, and the door is constantly banging. Breakfast was fresh and plentiful and well cooked, with very good service. All in all a good hotel if you get the right room

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: laxgirl24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the first place on our honeymoon around Europe and this was by far our favorite hotel of the trip. It was in a great location - lots of places to walk to- this area of Barcelona was our favorite. The pool on the roof was a great way to relax one afternoon - although the water was REALLY cold! But was still enjoyable. The room was a good size, bed was comfortable, and the hotel was clean. The computers with internet in the lobby were nice also. We would definitely stay here again for our next trip to Barcelona and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: final_destination
Reviews.Content: At the last minute we were able to extend out stay in Barcelona, but it was too late to tag on another day in the original hotel we were staying in, so we booked our last night here. Upon entering we wished that we had booked our entire Barcelona stay here. The decor and accomodations were so great (most comfortable bed we had during our vacation in Spain and we stayed in 6 hotels!) and the staff was more than helpful. It was just an added bonus that this hotel was more central to the city than the one we stayed at in the El Born district. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bez5
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a five night stay at this hotel in mid August. Excellent location only 40 metres from the Cathedral square, five minutes walk to La Rambla, the Gothic Quarter and Placa Catalunya for the Metro and Airport bus terminal (only Eur 7-20 return and very convenient, every few minutes). As previous reviews indicate, a new hotel, rooms and facilities excellent, as is service, cleanliness, etc. Although breakfast is a bit expensive, it is very good and almost worth it! Even the free internet facility was useful. We had a standard room which was a good size, nice bathroom, all very modern, flat screen tv, if you have time to watch it! The bed was firm but very comfortable with clean white linen and duvets, changed daily. The adjacent street has limited traffic, so there was no noise, even in the city centre. Rooms have tea making facilities, but my only criticism is that they charge for use of tea/coffee, so take your own tea bags! The rooftop pool with limited sunbeds is nice enough to relax either before or after walking around the city, we walked for miles every day. Even with six days in Barcelona, we hadn`t seen everything, there is so much to see and do. No hesitation in recommending and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a magic place.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyOztraveller
Reviews.Content: Wow what a location. Four days and still too much to see and do. The hotel is ideally located in the not so crowded Gothic quarter. An incredibly clean and modern hotel . Excellent size rooms and bathrooms. All staff were exemplary and know there stuff. The pool is great for a quick afternoon cool off and the free Sunday morning walking tour was the icing on the cake. Well done Catedral.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Qzy
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good hotel in a great location. The staff were very friendly and helped out any way they could. We had adjoining rooms which worked out very well, they were a decent size with bath and showers. The Air Conditioning worked perfectly and was a gift after a day out and about in the heat. We had a very minor leak in the roof during our stay and when we rang reception they sent a guy up straight away. He had us moved to other adjoining rooms within minutes and there was a free bottle of champagne waiting for us when we got there! Breakfast was included in our package and was fine, the fresh orange juice very nice. My wife did not enjoy the tea though. As has been mentioned here before, the Taxi driver took a while to find the hotel, the free internet is very handy, and there is no possibility of a drink from the (very small) bar after 11pm (lots of options close by though), but this certainly did not detract from a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: scadroes
Reviews.Content: We didn’t enjoy our stay at this hotel. The room was clean and the bathroom was clean and large and the location was great. It was right across the street from the Cathedral and a few minute walk from the Ramblas. We walked everywhere while we were there. The first thing we didn’t like was the bed. It was really hard. They did put a blanket under the sheet to make it a bit more comfortable after we asked them four times, but the bed was still really hard. The front desk wasn’t very helpful. When we checked in at 830 in the morning when were got off a cruise ship they told us t come back at 3 to get into our room. That was expected but when we returned to get into our room they gave away our nonsmoking room to someone else before us. They didn’t seem to care that we were there at 830 in the morning and already checked in. One morning they didn’t give us the wake-up call we asked for. After that we depended on our cell phone alarm instead not wanting to try that again. Also in the bathroom when they took the washcloth they didn’t replace it for the next day. It is a shame that this hotel had so many problems. It was really nice place in a good location. It just seemed like the people didn’t know how to manage the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: NYtraveler80
Reviews.Content: We loved our four night stay at Hotel Catedral in Barcelona. The rooms were modern and clean with a nice size bathroom. The hotel is situated in a great location within walking distance to the Ramblas, Boqueria market and great shopping. The staff was professional and friendly. The hotel lobby was nice with a terrace/garden. Also, there are three computers with free internet access for hotel guests to use. (fyi - watch out for the bored children using the computers for video games). Overall, it was a great stay and we would return again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay at the Hotel Catedral”
Reviews.Author: Triplalot
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 day stay with my 17 year old daughter at this hotel. Checkin was efficient, although we could not checkin properly until after 2PM (we arrived at 11.30), but the hotel kindly stowed our luggage and we were able to explore the surrounding areas. The hotel is really well located, in the middle of everything, close to some of the sites (opposite the Cathedral), close to the shops and a short walk to both Las Rambla and Pl. de Catalunya. We were a little disappointed with the hotel room, especially our very hard twin beds which were placed next to each other (like a kingsize) rather than a twin. However the room was clean, and the bathroom was very nice with a fullsize bath (albeit a little shallow). We did'nt have a good view since we were on a side street, opposite some apartments, and we were definitely overlooked. However the room was quiet. Breakfast was ok, although we only ate there once since my daughter preferred the nearby Starbucks. We didn't try the restaurant since it closes at 5PM, and we didn,t spend much time at the hotel during the day. We did try to get a drink on one occasion but gave in after a 10 minute wait. The room were airconditioned, although we never managed to control the temperature which when the air conditioning was on was very cold (nice when you come in from an hot day in Barcelona, but uncomfortable at night). The gym looked very nice and modern and the rooftop pool was a nice bonus, although my daughter said it was too cold. The pool area was also very small with a limited number of loungers (circa 8) which was not sufficient for the size of the hotel, and on one occasion (out of 2 visits) we had to sit on the wooden decking because no seats were available. Staff were friendly, although discreet. Final bonus was the free wireless internet, and the 3 computers in the lobby for the guests use. We used these to check emails, cat on MSN and to checkin for our flight home. However, there was no printer so we couldn't print our boarding passes which in fairness was not a big problem. In summary this is a good hotel at a reasonable rate, ideally placed for a short stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ralph8546
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the wonderful city of Barcelona, and stayed at the Catedral for 3 nights. It is a fabulous hotel, brilliantly positioned. The staff are very warm and friendly. The rooms are spotless and spacious and bathroom likewise. If you require a drink from the bar it is very reasonably priced. We stayed in a superior room which is larger than the standard rooms. A couple of criticisms the charge of €18 per person for a small continental breakfast, only rolls and jam and a small portion of fresh fruit was very expensive, go out and find one of the many local spanish cafe's who will do you a better breakfast for less than half the price. Also if you require more coffee in the room they will charge you €1.50 for another sachet, take your own! I have never paid for extra coffee anywhere in the world! Always make sure you have the address of the hotel including the zip code with you because none of the 6 or so taxis we used during our stay knew where it was, in fact the taxi driver from the airport had to phone the hotel to get directions. It is down a veryh tiny narrow street. However a very recommendable hotel we will definitely be going back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DianaWWiltshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Hotel Catedral yesterday and I cannot find anything bad to say about it. I took my son and his girlfriend for his 21st birthday treat and both double rooms on the second floor were lovely and the bathrooms gorgeous. Both faced out onto a side street but it was not noisy at all and the air con worked really well anyway if the windows were shut. The staff were friendly and everything very clean and the decor was great. It was pretty hot this week and fairly busy and being able to just step off the street into an oasis of calm was an absolute treat each time! Everything it says on their website is true and I am not posting any photos because the ones I took mirror those on the hotel website! My son used the gym and said it was good though not air conditioned which was odd, and we used the rooftop pool which was lovely. The hotel's position just off the Catedral Square was absolutely brilliant and a complete bonus as I didn't realise it was a pedestrianised area; that is the one thing that the website doesn't publicise which it should do as it is such a big plus. You can walk to so much and whilst it is very close to Las Ramblas it could be miles away in terms of noise. One reviewer says the bar and restaurant weren't open and whilst it is true that the bar closed at 10pm when we were there, I think maybe at weekends it would be later and certainly the restaurant was full a couple of lunchtimes we noticed. Although it is Italian I recommend La Locanda which is literally just around the corner from the Hotel Colon (on the Catedral Square also) - they use absolutely fresh ingredients and their pizzas are to die for. I also recommend going up to the roof of the Cathedral in the elevator as the views are something else. I didn't have to queue at all whereas the queues for the Gaudi Sagrada Familia were 90 minutes!!!! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and intend to visit it again just as soon as I can!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, modern, central but quiet....”
Reviews.Author: LMandTJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in May 08 for 3 nights on a city break to see Barcelona. The hotel has a great location, just off the Cathedral square and within easy walking distance to La Rambla and Placa Catalunya. For a city centre hotel and such a central location, the hotel is surprisingly quiet. We had a really nice room overlooking the street, we had two single beds instead of a double but it was no big deal, although the beds were quite hard! Bathroom was lovely and clean, nice modern fittings and a good powerful shower. Our only real issue with the room was the heat! It was really warm and the air conditioning unit made little difference even when it was turned down to 5 degrees! But maybe this was just the unit in our room, it didn't bother us enough to swap rooms. They don't replace the tea and coffee once you have used it, you have to buy more from the mini bar, but i'd read this on other reviews before I went so I took some with me. I found it odd that the restaurant wasn't open in the evenings and the bar never seemed to be either, We normally like to have a drink in the hotel bar before heading out or a last drink at night but there never seemed to be anyone around? There are plenty of bars nearby though, we usually ended up in Taverne de Bisbe in the Cathedral square for our last drink at the end of the night. We also tried the restaurant next door to the hotel called Nonell, which looks really nice from the outside, with a lovely outside dining area, however my boyfriend had a really bad meal there and they didn't have the wine we wanted so we accepted their reccomendation for a more expensive one which wasn't great either! We always seemed to find nice places to eat in Placa Reial, which you can get to just off Via Ferran. We had a lovely meal at Taxidermista and looked at all the people queuing up to get into Les Quinze Nits which i've heard is only average and they turn the tables round really quick so no sitting lingering over a drink like we were able to do. We felt perfectly safe walking up Portaferrissa back to the hotel from La Rambla late at night, we never saw any trouble during our stay. All in all we had a great trip and I would definitly use this hotel again if we returned to Barcelona :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TeWe
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights here in the beginning of May and absolutely loved it. The location couldn't be better, the hotel is right in the middle of everything in Barcelona and yet it is out of the hazzle so you get your privacy. We asked for and got a room facing the courtyard in order to ensure that it would be quiet. This was also the case, we didn't face any disturbance during our stay. The room was simple but very comfortable. The only downsides might be that there could be more closet space and as somebody else mentioned earlier my wife would also have wanted a full size mirror. Apart from these minor details it was perfect. Very clean and very comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. We got answers to all our questions whenever needed. Very pleasant stay and I could definitely consider staying here again when in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Clacy
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. We had connecting rooms as we travelled with our children. These were accessed through a lockable 'front door' which meant that we could leave our bedroom doors ajar at night. Rooms were large and the beds were enormous! Free wifi in all hotel rooms and free internet access on hotel pcs in lobby. Breakfast was nice but expensive. Great staff - highly recommended Fantastic location as very central but incredibly quiet at night. Never have we slept in such a quiet hotel in a city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rozzers
Reviews.Content: This is a newly refurbished hotel up a side street opposite the Cathedral. We chose it from reviews on this site and for its great location. We stayed for 5 nights early April for a city break. It's a great looking hotel inside. The foyer is beautifully designed and immediately restful after the bustle of the streets. You can sit and read in the comfy chairs of the foyer or have a drink from the bar. Reception staff were very pleasant and professional, spoke excellent English and responded to any requests willingly. We chose not to stay in our first allotted room, a lovely room but with a bit of noise from the lift shaft and there was no fuss about changing us. Our room was on the 2nd floor overlooking the courtyard, spotless and modern with some nice design features (funky lights, wall-mounted flat screen TV). The bathroom was very spacious in beige colour stone and suited our needs perfectly. It had a good powerful shower over a large white stone bath. The view from our room, over the hotel courtyard or covered chillout area (! their description) was of the back of the hotel facing the square, so not very pretty, but the room was very peaceful and we werent there that much in the daytime to let it bother us. But I guess that is the toss up - do you ask for a room overlooking the side street with a better view but a bit more noise or do you enjoy the peace and cope with looking at the balconies of the building in front...The only moan about the room was that it lacked a full length mirror and that the girls were very tight with replacing any toiletries that were finished. Also there was no tea after the first lot was drunk but we were warned and bought some more from the bar downstairs along with a jug of milk that we kept in the minibar. You may also have to ask for soap, they provide bath/shower gel, but there was no great problem, reception being happy to send some up. We ate all of our meals out of the hotel. There are plenty of places for breakfast nearby - much nicer to sit and eat watching the world go by and considerably cheaper too. We had a couple of drinks at the bar and outside in the chillout courtyard ( a pleasant decked area covered with tarpaulin to keep off the sun and lined with bamboo plants. Tables and chairs or low sofas to choose from - friendly service). The restaurant didnt operate in the evenings, only at lunch time - something that we werent told beforehand - so we ate out every night. No great hardship though it would have been nice to know there was no "home" option before we went. There is room service but only til 9.30pm. We sat on the roof terrace once at the end of the day with books. It's nicely done, with comfy loungers and painted walls. The view is over neighbouring rooftops. The long, thin pool was freezing when I dipped my toe in, maybe it gets warmer as the months go by into summer. We used the gym 3 times. There is one treadmill, one sit up bike and one cross trainer, some free weights, a bench, some wall bars - so small but functional. Again it is newly done with a great view through glass panels over the rooftops. Luckily no one else was interested in using it whilst we were there (I wonder why!) otherwise it would have been a bit of a squash. All in all a great hotel that I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. Our room was clean, modern and a good size. We requested a quiet non-smoking room and that is what we got (room 102). We could not fault the cleanliness or appearance of both our room and the hotel. Staff were friendly and very helpful. The hotel is in an excellant location. The A1 airport bus drops you at Placa de Catalunya which is a 5 minute walk away. We walked everywhere and there are lots of good restaurants closeby. The hotel is a few minutes walk from La Rambla and many other attractions. Restaurants that we would recommend are Les Quinze Nits (Placa Reial), Gauchos (Baixada Sant Miquel 6) and La Fonda (Carrer dels Escudellers 10). Breakfast was not included in our stay and we felt that the €18 per person to eat in the hotel was expensive. Instead, we bought our breakfast at various local patisseries (lots nearby) for around €5 for two people. Other reviewers have mentioned noise at the hotel and we could not hear anything from either outside or within the hotel. Overall an excellent hotel which we will be recommending to our family and friends. Would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: themutiman
Reviews.Content: A few gripes: Most rooms overlook a very noisy alley, making it impossible to keep the windows open. The live music from a bar in the same alley just compounded it. The walls (a misnomer) appear to be made from thick paper, and we were treated to our neighbour's discussions and farmyard noises too from time to time - not so nice! There is a kettle, and the first round of tea/coffee is "complimentary". Thereafter, its must be purchased at 1.50 euros per beverage. Not impressed with that. Solution: just pick up a jar of instant for your stay, and that's that. Breakfast: expensive for what it was, and the buffet part was very meager and disappointing. It is a very convenient location, so no complaints there. Would I stay there again: no. There is no shortage of good accommodation in the city, so I would choose elsewhere. It is a great city to visit, and there is so much to see and do. I would recommend hotels around the Gothic quarter. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tyneen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel which we found to be excellent. Staff friendly and welcoming on arrival to the hotel, our room wasnt ready but we were able to leave our luggage so that we could wonder round and explore the area in the meantime. Our room faced the street, we had no problems with noise either from outside or neighbouring rooms. We took our own tea bags after reading reviews from other travellers and bought milk and bottled water from a spar shop close by. There is a mini bar in the room which we used to store the milk in and there is a kettle and cups provided. There is a lovely gym on the top floor of the hotel, and an outside swimming pool with relaxer chairs to chill out on. Although the weather was warm and sunny the pool was icy cold and not warm enough to swim in yet, will be lovely in the summer. We had breakfast included in the price of our stay which was very nice. selection of cereals, yoghurts, fruit. fruit juice, tea, coffee. Baskets of cakes, pastries and breads were provided at your table and we had american breakfast which consisted of srambled or fried eggs, ham, tomato and toast. you could order extra toast or eggs too. We took a small bottle of fruit juice with us to our room for later. We used the free internet access in the main lobby area to check in online with ryan air for our return boarding passes and the staff at reception printed the passes out for us. Reception staff all very helpful with any queries, requests etc. Shops and restaurants close by with plenty of choice, hotel within easy walking distance of Ramblas, tourist buses, etc. Great stay and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Leesh77
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona Catedral Hotel is a great hotel in an extremely convenient location, situated steps from the Barcelona Cathedral. The staff is extremely friendly, and speak wonderful English. We arrived at 8 am and were exhausted, and they tried their best to get us a room as soon as possible. We even fell asleep in the lobby, and they kindly nudged us when our room was ready (nearly 2 hours before check in)! My friend also left her cellphone in the room safe, and they worked with her over the phone and sent it to us at our hotel in Madrid. The hotel itself is new and modern. Our room, which was the standard room, was a good size by European standards, and the bathroom was spacious and pristine. Our room faced the street, and although late at night there was some noise, it was nothing to lose sleep over. There was a new flatscreen TV which offered a few stations in English, as well as a mini bar (that is a bit pricey) and room safe (that camouflages cell phones - beware! ahahaha.) If I had one complaint -- it would be that at times, we could hear the guests in the adjacent room. It was not a huge deal though. In the lobby there are computers for your use, and there is a very comfortable outdoor lounge. We did not use the restaurant, so I cant comment on it. They did offer a breakfast for about 18-20 Euro ($30!!), but there are plenty of places to pick up a bite to eat just steps from the hotel, that are a fraction of the price. It was too cold for the rooftop pool, although it looked great, and they also have a small gym. In terms of location, you are 30 seconds from the Cathedral, and about a 5-10 minute walk to the metro, Las Ramblas, the Picasso Museum - everything. Truly a central and practically perfect location. I booked using the hotel website, and it was quick and convenient. I got a rate (roughly $200 USD per night) that i thought was very competitive with other hotels in its category (4 stars) and location. I highly reccommend the Barcelona Catedral Hotel, its a great place to stay in a truly wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: travelover125
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a last minute getaway based on the reviews posted on this site. This hotel definately deserved the high marks. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The rooms weren't spacious, but comparable to other European hotels. The location was the absolute best part of the hotel. It is literally around the corner from the Catedral Gotic and walking distance to the Ramblas. The front desk staff spoke great English and went out of their way to be helpful. One gentleman (I wish I could remember his name), young bald fellow, was especially helpful and he made my stay fantastic. I would definately stay here on my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Jugaloonie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first wedding anniversary from the 4th to the 7th January. At the time of booking we didn't realise that it was in fact the Festival of the Three Kings in Spain and so were slightly worried that it would be very busy. This was certainly not the case. On the eve of the Epiphany the streets became crowded with families watching the parade but apart from that it was pretty quiet for the rest of our stay. Despite the fact that it was a public holiday, all bars and restaurants were still open for business too. The hotel seemed quiet although we did use it as a base only and had all our meals out and about. We were very impressed by the size of the room. The room was spotlessly clean and we had fresh towels every day. Huge, super king size bed, the down side being that it was extremely hard and uncomfortable. The bathroom was large too with extra toiletries if needed. There is a hairdryer supplied in the bathroom but the one in ours didn't work although I'd taken my own so it wasn't a problem. Again, a slight criticism was that the tea & coffee supplies are for your arrival and not topped up during your stay. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful too. We flew to Gerona airport and then arrived in Barcelona by coach so on our departure, the reception staff very kindly printed out a timetable for the Gerona coaches so that we didn’t miss our flight home! The location of the hotel is perfect. You are a 5 second stroll from the Cathedral Square and only 5 minutes from Playa de Catalunya and La Rambla. Probably only a 20 minute walk to the Barcaloneta area and the beach which is well worth a visit. We did the cable car ride which has the most amazing views over the city. We also purchased a one day tourist bus ticket (in hindsight should have got a 2 day!) which we used to explore the north of the city. Stopped off at Sagrada Famillia and Park Guell which were amazing. We were very lucky with the weather whilst in Barcelona too. On arrival in Gerona it was raining but then you are close to the mountains. Once in Barcelona we had our first day at about 16 degrees and then the last two it was 20 degrees and sunny still at 4:30 in the afternoon! We did feel very strange though as for the locals this is still cold. So whilst we were wandering around in jeans and t-shirts, they were wrapped up in thick coats and scarves! I really did feel like saying that this was better than our summer of 2007!

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Loud”
Reviews.Author: Dr.Papenhagen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located just north of Central Ramblas, situated across the courtyard from the Catedral. It is extremely easy to walk to Barcelona’s many attractions from this hotel. The courtyard has several restaurants with a great crepe shop on the corner. The staff is pleasant and well accommodating to your needs and the rooms are clean and chic. Now the bad news. Or it depends how you look at it. For the money and after traveling much of the world, this is a pretty good deal if you are on a Euro budget, or want to consume more wine or tapas (which is myself), but if you have an excess of Euros, and want something a little grander, you may be disappointed. Although the bed looks lovely, the mattress and pillows are rock hard and in serious need of replacement. The walls are paper-thin and I could hear the TV and conversations in the next hotel room. Lastly, a good majority of the rooms face the alley and unless your a hard sleeper or hard of hearing, you will hear all of the end of the night goodbyes. I like the hotel, just be a wise traveler and know what to expect. Ted

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: H009
Reviews.Content: Great hotel just a few strides from the square in front of the old cathedral. A short walk from all means of transport. Surprisingly quiet considering it is so close to the hustle and bustle of central Barcelona. The hotel itself was very good and we would have awarded it an excellent if it had been a little warmer. The weather was cold when we visited and a few more degrees of heat would have been nice although it certainly wasn't enough to spoil our time there. The bedrooms are well set out and the bathroom was lovely with a 'proper' bath and shower. Excellent safe (no extra charge) and plenty of clothes storage. We didn't use the restaurant so can't comment but the bar area was comfortable and the drinks were reasonably priced and actually cheaper than some of the bars surrounding it! The staff were very polite, courteous and helpful and the maid service unobtrusive. Whatever time we left, the rooms were always cleaned, tidied and re-stocked with towels before we got back. One whinge - tea and coffee is only provided for your arrival further supplies have to be bought from the room bar/fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Oscar Brian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a three day break from Friday to Monday. The hotel is really well located in a central location that is very convenient for walking to all the main tourist areas and about 7 minutes walk from where the airport bus terminates in Placa Catalunya. The staff were very friendly and helpful in what is a modern but attractive hotel. The rooms are really well designed with a king size bed and very large bathroom. Our room overlooked the internal coutyard and whilst not an amazing view, it meant that it was very quiet for a location so close to the busy Cathedral area. We didn't have breakfast as at 15 Euros each it seemed a bit excessive and there are plenty of cafes around where you can get a fruit juice, coffee and croissant for under 5 Euros. Similarly loads of places to eat around and about, all of which were very accommodating and explained their menus etc if needed. Barcelona was a great place to visit for a long weekend. The Metro is very cheap and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “what a gem”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelCumbria
Reviews.Content: Hotel was wonderful. It was at the back of the cathedral in the old town, which is a lovly area to exploir and is quiter than the other areas. the rambellers is a 10 min walk and all the majour sights are sign posted. The hotel wave very clean lovle sixes modern rooms all newly decorated. the staff are so helpful and friendly. the pool is small but it is lovly to sit on the roof looking out onto the rooftops .. Go to a football match if you have time gat tickets from easyjet internet bar on rambellers it is on right hand side heading to harbour. The harbour is beautiful place to go also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: mikesierra
Reviews.Content: Excellent modern hotel in a superb location and well worth the high ratings given by others, which we used to help us select it. The location close to the cathedral (obviously!) is a prime postion for all attractions/tourist and transport links. Rooms were spacious and had bath/shower (over) and king size beds. Bar was excellent and not over expensive - didn't try the restaurant as there were so many places close by for food. The gym and swimming pool were an added bonus. There were 3 internet terminals available to residents at no charge. We were in a party of 8 and the only negative comment was that one couple were charged 1.50 Euro for some additional teabags. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: ArmaghG
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel and had a brilliant time there. The hotel is modern, trendy and everything is new. The staff were friendly and helpful whenever possible. We didn't eat in the hotel at all - when I was booking it I thought the breakfast was a bit expensive at 15 euro (plus VAT) per person per day. There was no shortage of resturants etc to eat in the area so we were never stuck. Fab food all round the city. The room was great - and the bathroom was lovely, really modern. The door in the bathroom wasn't a problem at all! The room was always well cleaned - although they start early! I would highly recommend this hotel - the location couldn't be better, everything you need is close by. I booked this hotel because I wanted to be close to the city centre but also to have a pool to relax at during lazy days and it fitted the bill. The roof top pool is lovely - the weather was really good during our stay so we spent a couple of days sun bathing...heaven! One complaint would be that on 2 of the days during our stay the pool was only half full - I'm not sure why as we didn't ask - but it was very annoying as we couldn't swim in it. But when it was full it was lovely for a quick dip. The pool wasn't heated which wasn't a problem for us but may be in the cooler weather. Barcelona is a brilliant city with lots to do and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone - it's excellent!
